text:
Barwa czarna z ciemnobrązowymi przebłyskami.

Piana obfita (ledwo mieści się w szkle), drobnopęcherzykowa, koloru écru. Gęsto oblepia szkło w chwili opadania, po paru chwilach redukuje się do cienkiego kożuszka, do końca pozostaje małą wysepką i pierścieniem przy szkle. Lacing średni.

Aromat kakaowy, gorzkiej czekolady, w tle lekkie nuty palone.

Smak słodkawy, następnie suszonych, wędzonych śliwek oraz lekkie nuty kakaowe. Na finiszu lekka kwaskowatość i goryczka kawowa, która dobrze ukrywa alkohol. Piwo przywodzi na myśl delikatny likier kawowo-śliwkowy z palonymi nutami słodowymi.
Warka 05.11.2013

Dun brun foncé quasiment noir et parée dune fine mousse brune (ne nappant malheureusement pas entièrement la surface), cette Porter de la brasserie Nogne vous fera passer assurément passer une agréable soirée : bon équilibre amertume/sucre/alcool et arômes de café/chocolat agréables. Néanmoins, un final pas entièrement abouti et un manque de complexité lui portent préjudice pour une plénitude totale. Au nez, les arômes sont intenses, en premier lieu sur le café, puis le chocolat, le tout relevé par une pointe vanillée : très belle alliance sur un équilibre parfait. Lattaque, souple et soyeuse se présente cependant sur des arômes de café modérés qui ne sont que de simples murmures sur une belle mélodie de chocolat malté. La deuxième bouche gagne encore en douceur, davantage sur le malt, toujours sur le chocolat mais complété par des fruits confits. Larrière bouche qui se superpose et splendide, fraîche, houblonnée, sur des arômes de café francs, saillants. La corpulence est relativement bonne. La troisième bouche souvre alors sur une amertume fine tout en restant modérée (IBU de 30, utilisation de Centennial et Nothern Brewer, aromatiques), avant un final, modérément long, revenant sur des notes de café. Celui-ci manque cependant denvolée et ne permet pas de clore la dégustation de façon flamboyante. Peut être un petit manque sur lalcool à 7 % Abv qui jusquà présent jouait très bien son rôle à la fois dans le soutien aux arômes et à la structure. Le sucre de son côté est parfaitement dosé ainsi que léquilibre malt/houblon très bien trouvé. Le plaisir est néanmoins présent, pour une belle porter sans surprise mais bien réalisée.

UPDATED: MAY 13, 2017 Po nalaniu ładnie się prezentuje z tą wysoką, zbitą pianą, jednak szybko się redukuje do 2 mm, fajnie pachnie kawą z mlekiem lub inką, gorzką czekoladą, karmelem, suszone owoce, ale w smaku już raczej wzgl. aromatu to zawodzi, wydaje się puste, brakuje mu ciała, wytawna, gorzka kawa.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.

UPDATED: APR 27, 2017 Donkerbruin titel zwart met iets licht onderin, flink koolzuur, licht bruine enorme schuimkraag met grote bellen..... even laten rusten en bijtappen en hij is goed.Aroma: Donkere geroosterde mouten, zoethout, melkchocolade, vanille en fruitige hop.Smaak: Roasty, gebrande mout, dark koffie, Chocolade, vanille, droog. Goed gehopt....mooie fruitige hint tussen de roast door en een subtiele bitter. Alles mooi in balans...Geen uitschieters daardoor een toegankelijke Porter. Boven medium body, zacht mondgevoel, afdronk is subtiel roast en bitter en iets droog.Prettig!

Bottle at The Leeky Tap, Leek. Pours a deep brown colour with a medium tan head. Aroma of dark fruits, liquorice, bready malts, some sherry, slight cherry, a little chocolate and subtle coffee.
Taste of roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, dark fruits, some liquorice, slight cherry, a hint of alcohol and subtle spice. Medium bodied and moderate carbonation. A dryish, dried fruit bitterness in the finish. A good old fashioned Porter, just like their Stout. Simple but wow! Its done so well. Very nice.
Pours a dark thick black with a small tanned head. Aromas of malt, caramel and coffee. BIG coffee taste with a dark chocolate finish. Really great. So drinkable.

Its becoming clear to me that Scandinavians dont mess around with dark beer. They like their Porters to be rich, robust, and roasty. Nøgne Ø Porter is no exception. Its appearance is damn near to being black. It has a creamy tan head. Notes of dark chocolate, coffee, and dried dark fruit. Thick, velvety mouthfeel. To enjoy this beer, make it a little warm and it will respond in kind.
Kruidig en zurig aroma. Bittere koffie en rode bosvruchten in de smaak. Fijne zurige tonen. Droge afdronk.

Bottle.

A- Chocolate, slightly weak.

A- Dark brown color, dark body, light brown head.

T- Cocoa, cola, roasty.

P- Full body, average texture, average carbonation, balanced finish.

O- Good and balanced. Not really any standout flavors. May seem dull to some because its so straightforward but its done so well.
From tap. Black with a beige head. Aroma and flavour of roasted malt, licorice, coffee, chooclate, caramel, bread and dried fruit.
細緻的泡沫帶
At BKL - dark brown color. Coffee and dark malts mixed together with character. Dry finish. nice.
Bottle from Crafty Bottle, Lincoln. Almost black colour with tan head. Roasted malty and light toffee aroma. Taste roasted bitter. Full body.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 backlog Rami Rami is drinking a Porter by Nøgne Ø at PowiśleMocno owocowy, palony, kawowy, lekki, wysoko dosc wysycony, cocacolowy... FajnyOcena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

Aroma is dark malts with a softer roasted note. Light coffee. Taste is dark and bitter, with a balanced hop profile and dried darker fruits. Light chocolate notes as well. This is a classic porter. Nothing fancy, nothing colorful - just a proper porter. Legit!

500 ml bottle, hazy dark brown nearly black, beige head.
coffee, roasty, brown sugar, dried fruits, chocolate, wood, also has some hoppy flavours.
medium to full body, oily to watery texture, very balanced in roastyness, bitterness and sweetness.

Bottle @ home, brewed 2015-03. Pours almost black with a beige head. Aroma is smoothly roasted with rich milk chocolate, plums, fruity coffee, deep caramel, some licorice,slight vinous vanilla notes. Body is medium, carbonation average with soft bubbles. Medium duration. Flavors of milk chocolate, plums, licorice, nuts, coffee. Finish has lingering toffee, licorice and ash. balanced low to medium bitterness.
From bottle. Pours opaque dark brown. Nose of coffee, dark chocolate, leather, pine, earth. Taste is chewy, woody, well-rounded hop complexity.

Pours a huge foamy brownish head and has a pretty dark brown almost pitch black appearance. Head never lets up, with huge thick lacing. Aromas of toffee, caramel, breads mild barley and spiced hops. Flavours are fairly mild and not too bitter at all, pretty smooth. Have some sweet taste coming through, some earthy hops and a bit of spices. Notes of chocolate and nuts as well. Smooth creamy mouthfeel, a bit of a slick sensation on the palate. Lively carbonation with a slight warming touch. Nicely balanced, smooth and easy to drink. Very good. Would love to try other Nogne beers.

Porter de 7 % abv, pour 16,5° plato, et 29 ebu.
En format 50 cl, mon exemplaire provenait du batch 1406 du 7 avril 2015, il était valable 3 ans, et se trouvait donc à 1 an et demi en pleine maturité.
Malts Maris Otter, munich, cara, choco et black. Houblonnage en centennial et northern brewer.
Cette bière a eu laward de la meilleure bière norvégienne en 2013.
Couleur noir dencre, à lopacité très forte.
Mousse en nappage soyeux brun moyen.
Arômes de ganache, chocolat au lait, vanille.
1ère bouche souple à lensemble café/chocolat/malt torréfié, au bel équilibre.
Arrière-bouche où vient la complexité, avec des baies noires.
2ème sur du pain noir allemand, malt torréfié, café.
Arrière-bouche large, au beau caractère.
3ème au grand équilibre entre malt et houblon.
Arrière-bouche dune grande élégance.
Longueur qui travaille bien le sujet mais pas tout à fait au top.
Jambes huileuses, longues.
Levure souple, un peu terreuse, un peu vineuse, belle ligne dune ale anglaise.
Alcool correct, mais il manque lenvol de la finale.
Finale délicieuse, mais pas merveilleuse, comme on lespérait.
CONCLUSION : très grand porter incontestablement, qui vogue en haut vol, mais manque son 
envol complet en finale.

Piwo praktycznie czarne, klarowne, z piękną, drobnopęcherzykową pianą, ładnie osadzającą się na szkle. W aromacie przede wszystkim kawa i odrobina czekolady, w smaku dochodzą do tego wyraźne nuty palone i delikatna kwaśność od ciemnych słodów. Goryczka średnio wysoka, trochę za wysokie wysycenie.

500ml bottled10/2015, Bier&Co. - Bref: amps the classic UK porter recipe into controlled ImpStout territory, hijacking espresso and milk chocolate with confident Scandinavian umami/alkaline touches of salted liquorice and roasted nuts, adding awareness of forest fruits (brambleberry). Quite high carbonation for the style, propelling all fresh, forestine dark fruity flavours to the palate with enthusiasm and insistence. A porter with a coastal bite...

Keg @Cimmeria, Oviedo. 25-11-2016.
In short: tasty porter.
Pours dark with nice tan head, frothy, persistent. Good lacing. Roasty, coffee, licorice nose. Medium body, average carbonation, oily texture. Taste is coffee, roasty, nuts, maybe a bit watery for 7%. Enjoyable anyway.
Black with brown head. Aroma of roasted malts, cocoa, black bread, coffee. Taste of chocolate, roasted malts, bitter coffee and some alcohol.

zwart met fijne bruine kraag. aroma van veel chocolade, melkchocolade, vanille, zoet, geroosterd, marshmallow/spekjes, Smaken gebrande/geroosterde mout, licht pepertje, vanille, donkere chocolade, melkchocolade, cacao, zacht, glad, koffie, redelijke co2

Aroma:

Slight/medium aroma of malts, caramel, liquorice, chocolate, roasted malts and coffee.

Appearance:

Opaque dark brown/black beer with a slight/medium brown head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium sweet with malts, caramel, liquorice and chocolate; ends slightly bitter and dry with roasted malts and coffee.

Overall:

This beer is complex and balanced, but lacks intensity. Amazingly complex and balanced, but might lack intensity. The aroma especially suffers from this. Could have been more roasted too. Close to being a great beer, but is simply too weak to achieve it.

Brown/black with lots of brown head. Aroma of burned toast and a caramel sweetness. When I swirl it around a nice hoppy aroma of hay and grass joins the party. The taste is medium sweet and has a powerfull roasted malt taste almost like burned coffee. The finish is dry and bitter. Really nice taste. Medium to full bodied and good carbonation. Good stuff.
Pitch black appearance with no head. Tastes of roasted malt, dark chocolate and vanilla. Fine carbonation, medium body and a finish of dark chocolate. Good porter
Bottle. Pours black with a medium brown head. Aromas of tobacco, tar, licorice, chocolate, malt, dark fruits. Taste is malty, ashy, roasty, tobacco, licorice, light smoke, chocolate, dark fruits.

Ciemnobr?zowe barwa, kremowa piana barwy ciemnobe?owej. Klarowne. Intensywny aromat czekolady, lekki aromat palonych s?odów, pralinek. W smaku czekolada, kwaskowo??, kakao, mocna kawa. Piwo ?wietnie u?o?one, g?adkie, zbilansowane.

Goede porter. Aroma: koffie en een zoete zweem. Smaak: mooie combinatie tussen bitter, hartig en zoet. Gebrande mout zorgt voor een houtachtige smaak. Rijp donker fruit zorgt voor de balans. Mooie porter.

W pokalu znajduje się bardzo czarna ciecz o sporej gęstości, zwieńczona beżową, ładnie budującą się pianą. Porter jest przede wszystkim bardzo gładki i wręcz oleisty, a także dosyć nisko nasycony. Ja takie lubię. Doskonała paloność miesza się w trakcie piwa z aromatem i smakiem gorącej czekolady i mocnej kawy. Na koniec dochodzi posmak kakao, pralin i daktyli. Porter jest bardzo przyjemnie zbalansowany - średnia pełnia i aromat sugerujący słodycz, a ta jest uzupełniona paloną gorzkością i odpowiednim nachmieleniem. Świetny porter!

Bottle 50cl. Poured into a shaker. Pitch black, tall frothy tan head, recedes slowly to a thick layer, good lacing; aroma roasted malts, cocoa, mocha, dark fruits; smooth taste, medium sweet and bitter, roasted malts, chocolate, ice coffee, hints of dark fruits; dry sweetbitter aftertaste, light bitter chocolate, lingering roasty undertone and light spicy notes; medium body, oily to creamy texture, soft carbonation; great porter, tasty and surprisingly fresh.

Opaque black with thin but persistent tan head. Velvety creamy full body with moderate carbonation.

Aroma: roast malt, dark fruit, plum, dr pepper, cacao.

Taste: brown malt, cacao nibs, roast malt.
500ml bottle at Balestrand, Norway. Aroma is coffee, toffee. Appearance is dark black with a brown foam. Taste ist bitter and light sour. Dry. Medium carbonation. Good.

Pours black with a brown head. It has good head retention with good lacing. It has aromas of chocolate, some coffee, roast, and a bit of citrus. There are flavors of chocolate, coffee, roast, a bit of citrus and dried fruit. It has a moderate body on the high side with fairly high carbonation. It has a moderately bitter finish with mild alcohol warmth. Overall this is a porter with excellent combination of malts with complexity between the chocolate and roast and a surprisingly hoppy bite to it.

500 ml bottle. Pours dark brown/black with a light brown creamy head. The aroma is full of roasted malts with cacao and a nuttily-woddy note. Medium to full body with low carbonation. Could be a little bit more creamy. Light to medium sweetness and a very light bitterness and some acidic notes. Taste ofroasted malts - molasse - with some sweet berries. Nice finish with that again features the roasted malts and adds a further dimension to the beer. Very nice porter.

Bottle @ home. Opaque black color, medium to full sized brown head. Aroma is malts, dark malts, soft roast and some coffee roast. Taste malts, bitter, dark malts, light roast, lightly hops and a slight touch of chocolate. Medium body, medium carbonation.

Bottle. Sensoric. Jet black with big, densed, light brown head. Medicare head retention and lacing. Nice, medium roasted malts aroma - mainly milk chocolate, cocoa and some coffee. Also somewhere in the background dried fruits, smooth toffee area, lightly smokey. Trace of booze noticable. Taste is lightly bitter, little acidic and dryish. Medium body, creamy and oily texture, average carbonation, finish is milk chocolate, lightly bitter and semi-dry. In overall nice and interesting porter. Highly drinkable, definitely worth trying.

bottle thanks to Klimaet. Pours a pitch black with a nice, tan head. Aroma has raisins, smokey malts, tar, licorice, chocolate, coffee, slight ashy. Taste is sweet, very roasty, again slight ash and a quite hoppy bitter after taste. Quite a lot of caramel too. Average to low carbonation and a semi-full, oily texture.

50 cl, bottle fermented, batch #1599. Jet black, thick creamy brownish tan head, looks fantastic. Lovely aromas of roasted malts, dark chocolate and coffee. Mouthfeel is creamy, rich, bitter and well carbonated. Flavours of dark bitter chocolate, coffee, roasted malts and tobacco smoke, long aftertaste. This batch was brewed quite recently, so it may benefit of ageing for a year or two.

A good pour but with no head. Molasses and dark roast malt on the nose. Chocolate and licorice with a hint of coffee and a touch of hop bitterness. Carbonation is bold. This is a nice thick bodied beer that is well balanced.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

50cl bottle. Dark brown pour with a thin beige head. Smells of roasted malts, smoke, chocolate. The taste follows the same notes, roasty and well balanced, with some brewed coffee thrown into the mix. Medium bodied, low carbonation and a bitter chocolate aftertaste.

Pours black with a finger of light tan head. Aroma of chocolate, roasted malt, German sausage, light molasses. Taste is roasty bitter with a mild chocolate sweet finish. Light and creamy body with soft carbonation.

Spora, beżowa i drobna piana, długo pozostaje w postaci chmurek i nieznacznie oblepia szkło. Barwa ciemno brązowa z rubinowymi refleksami, klarowna, spory osad na dnie butelki. Aromat przypomina świeżo paloną kawę w towarzystwie gorzkiej czekolady i wody mineralnej, jest też trochę kanalizy. W smaku półsłodkie, lekko szorstkie, ziemiste, znów króluje kawa, zarówno po turecku jak i espresso, czekolada, palony karmel. Goryczka niska do średniej, palona. Wysycenie niskie do średniego, półpełne w odbiorze. Dobrze ukryty alkohol.
Dość pijalny, gładki i smaczny Porter, fajnie zbalansowany i ułożony. Minusem niewielka wada w aromacie.

Appearance: completely black with a thin stout-ish head which remains for a long time. Aroma: sweet and distinctly smokey, sweet toffee and some treacle, woody/oak notes. Intriguing complex aroma with intense dark malt and burnt characteristics
Flavour: oily mouthfeel. Lots of cocoa and chocolate, some nice roasty flavours and coffee. Very smokey! The dark malts are very distinct but some underlying hops is also noticeable which gives it a nice bitter and grassy almost earthy dry finish. Brilliant Porter, showing off the style with a bit of smoke.

UPDATED: MAY 4, 2016 0.5L bottle from Beers of Europe. Black, with a beige head. Caramel, fruity malt, dark chocolate, hint of roasting, vanilla. Taste is rich, dark chocolate, coffee, earthy caramel malt and fruit hints, medium sweetness and bitter finish. Really nice porter.
Dark brown, low beige head. Aroma salty caramel, oats, toffee, pistaccios. Palate medium, bit too high carbonation. Taste umami, hazelnuts, chocolate. Very good beer.

Rated 27.03.2015. Bottle. Black colour, beige stable head. Rich and full aroma, which is really promising. Roasty, caramel, toffee, nuts, oatmeal, some fruity notes. Taste is quite similar.. Roasted, toffee, nuts, brown malt, cocoa. Very complex. Full body. A bit overcarbonated. Very good.

Botella. @El Lúpulo Feroz, Oviedo 17/03/2016 BBD:13/10/18
Color negro, espuma beige,, sabor dulce, notas regaliz, cuerpo medio.

Botella. Presencia caoba oscura con corana marfil persistente y compacta. Carbonatacion media. Aroma a pan y chocolate. Sabor sedoso con el alcohol bien integrado, dulce y cafe con largo amargor cafetoso.
smoke, vanilla, chocolate, coffee, black, hazy, brown foam, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, full body, oily feel, soft carbonation, bitter, long finish,
Una delle migliori porter mai assaggiate. Gustosa e complessa. Sentori dominanti di marzapane, caffè e cioccolato, nonché un floreale al naso. Corpo medio, la birra scivola benissimo. Capolavoro!

UPDATED: JAN 8, 2017 500ml bottle from Beers of Europe. Pours clear dark brown with a thin, persistent dark beige head. Nice lacing. Aromas of coffee and dark chocolate. Taste is rich strong coffee, more dark chocolate, earthy too. Long bitter finish. Hints of red berries on the end. Luscious.

Aroma and taste is medium sweet and roasted malty, chocolate and caramel sweetness, some coffee, smooth mouthfeel, nice vanilla nuance throughout, nice.

Robe brune presque noire, mousse crémeuse. Nez puissant et complexe, chocolat, café au lait, noisette, malt torréfié, fourrure. Bouche à lattaque crémeuse, belle ampleur, superbe rétro torréfiée, longueur et équilibre. Un très beau Porter de fin de soirée.

Bottle @ Favela, Helsinki. Pours black with a dense, fairly big head. The aroma displays a solid, dark and roasty malt profile; espresso, licorice, rye bread and some chocolate. Taste is dryish, medium to heavily roasty and in the finish, moderately bitter. Coffee and dark bread combine with licorice and chocolate. The palate is medium to full bodied with a creamy texture, low to average in carbonation. Warming, rich and balanced porter.

Pours a black from a bottle with a thin off-white head. Aroma of coffee, flavor adds dried figs. Very well-balanced, almost approaching a stout mouthfeel. Sort of like an oatmeal stout almost without that rounder feeling, or about as thin as a milk stout without the annoying lactic sugar added. Very good beer.

Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate and some coffee. The taste is a løittle bit bitter with coffee, roasted malts, hops, chocolate, licorice and nuts., but the roasted malts is by far the heavy one. Its a good porter, but personally I think its to much roasted to give it higher than 3.5....

Dark brown, not very persistent caramel head.
Coffee, black bread, caramel. 
Medium sweet, good bitterness, black coffee. Good harmony!

Bottle into goblet. Black. Thin tan head. Aroma of chocolate, coffee, hints of leather. Tastes like liquid silk. Creamy mouthfeel. Well balanced. Some initial bitterness followed by smooth creamy espresso notes. Hints of creme brûlée. Amazingly tasty porter. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

50cl bottle, served in tulip glass. Black with tan head. Aroma is roasted malts, dark chocolate and licorice. Taste is similar with a coffee touch. Very classic overall, quite smooth and absolutely no alcohol. Full body, good carbonation. As said above, its a good beer but nothing incredible.

Rating #1304 25.10.2014. Bottle from CBI. Rich, brown black pour with a creamy tan foam. Aroma is chocolate, toasted malt, espresso, mild vanilla.mild smoke.Creamy mouthfeel, low carbonation. Very complex, cool sweetness, toasted malt dominance, smooth finish, mild bitterness.

500ml bottle. Black with brown head. Aroma of roasted malts, cocoa, black bread, coffee beans and maybe a hint of tared wood. Taste of chocolate, roasted malts, bitter coffee and some warming alcohol. Medium, filling mouthfeel and medium to strong(er) carbonation driving the flavors.

Appearance Pours dark brown, with a tan head that lasts and leaves a nice lacing. 
Aroma Liquorice, roast malts, coffee, cocoa, vanilla 
Taste Balanced, but leaning towards bitter, with some pleasant astringent notes of roasted grains 
Palate Medium-low carbonation, mouthfeel almost creamy
Bottle shared with JFE at Våland 30.10.15. Ebony. Dense brown head and lacing. Aroma and taste of black malt, dark chocolate and liquorice.

Aroma of dark fruit, slight chocolate and coffee, toffee, vanilla and spice. Flavor of chocolate, roasty malts, coffee and slight spice. Nice, but a little thin on the palate.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Black color. Medium carbonation. Has fruity notes on tops of lovely burnt, roasted chocolate. Nice balance of sweetness to bitterness....a bit toward the bitter side...good hop touch. Tastes of chocolate and coffee with some spicy hoppiness. Very tasty.

Pours a rich, bubbly head, has an equally rich nose of roasted malts, chocolate etc. So far so good.. Incredibly smooth in the mouth, with a nice balance of cream/fizz. The flavour is lovely - nice burnt taste that you'd expect from a good porter, but a bit sweet as well. Close to perfection, this is surely the best porter I've had!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap @ basement beer bar, Aalborg. Aroma of chocolate, black malt, charcoal. Black with tan head, not lasting. More coffee and chocolate, moderate malt bitterness, light+ sweetness. Full body, oily smooth texture, light carbonation, roasted finish.

On tap Sorspecialista Budapest. Fruity hoppy aroma. Looks great black with nice finger+ head. Fresh tasting porter full of delicious chocolate, coffee, prune, fig, dark fruits, and dry hops. A bit heavy yeast gives it a lactic bite near the end, but still a cool porter.

Bottle from Vinmonopolet, Storslett. Opaque black color with intense small brown head. Aroma has salted licorice, roasted malt, caramel, tar. Taste is malty sweet with long dry only a little bitter aftertaste. Flavors of salted licorice, caramel, roasted malt, coffee, dark chocolate. Very drinkable and excellent aftertaste. Very well balanced.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Appearance is black, a tan foamy head which persists and clings. Aroma- very chocolatey- fudge, brownies, dark malts, coffee, slight vanilla tinge, chocolate syrup, bitter hop undertones. Taste- lots more chocolate. Chocolate ice cream, dark, bready malts, brown sugar, caramel, fudge, coffee beans, bittersweet finish with just a hint of very dark fruits. Quite a full and sticky mouthfeel. Excellent.

Bottle. Black pour, creamy head. Nice aroma of milky chocolate, red fruit, cream and coffee. Soft taste of coffee, milk chocolate, red ripe fruit, cherry, mocha and mild bitters. Very balanced and tasty. Great beer.

500ml bottle that poured just about solid black with a creamy lasting head & a fruity malty aroma this tastes really good creamy smooth slightly bitter full of flavour malt coffee chocolate range of fruit red wine all coming thru very nice
Almost black, brown head, good lacing. Delicate aroma of coffee and dried fruits. Smooth texture, chocolate, dried fruits in taste. Nice sour and bitter aftertaste.

The aroma is quite roasty with a lightly burnt, black malt character with some toffee-like, caramelly, chocolate, coffee, rich flavours. Medium to medium-full body with moderately high carbonation. Big, roasty aroma with notes of coffee, bitter cocoa, burnt sugar and oak. Fantastic flavour of dark chocolate and slightly over-roasted coffee, with a moderately dry finish.

Nøgne Ø Porter is very smooth and possibly the most full bodied porter Ive had to date. I love the rich cocoa presence and the roasted malt together. Theres a light coffee character as well, but without any of the bitterness commonly associated with it. The finish is sweet and dry.

Pours a solid black with a brown head and lacing. It has a nice aroma of dark chocolate toasty malt. The flavor is dark chocolate and some toast and dark fruit at the finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
bottle. Pours black with a small beige head. Coffee and roasted malt aroma. Roasty chocolate malt flavor. Medium bodied with creamy texture and lingering roasty finish. Pretty good.
In bottiglia. Aroma di tostato, cioccolato, liqwuirizia. Al palato corpo rotondo, sentori legnosi, tostato, vaniglia, cioccolato, caffè, liquirizia.

UPDATED: AUG 1, 2015 Bottle. Pours pitch black with one finger, but lasting creamy light brown head. Aroma is quite sweet, packed with dried fruits and port grapes. Dark roasty malts, bread crust, some sourdough and yeast. Taste is really fruity. Dark berries, dried fruits, slight acidic coffee, espresso, dark bitter chocolate. Medium body, light bitter, coffee beans in finish.
Black color with tan head.Taste is roasty with chocolate. Very easy to drink, One of the best porters i have tried.

Thick black colored, small non lasting tan head. Aroma is kinda sweet, chocolate, dark fruits, licorice, some roasted malt and coffee. Taste is moderate+ sweetness, bit toffee, chocolate, dark fruits and licorice, strong roasted and coffee dry bitterish finish with some sweetness and lasting aftertaste. Medium to full bodied, low+ carbonation, quite thick and creamy. Very good, would be excellent if only a bit less sweet.

500 ml bottle brewed 08.05.14, shared by Werckmeister, thanks!
Dark brown body, with a big, frothy, rocky, lacing, beige head.
Aroma of espresso, cocoa, dark chocolate, wood, dark fruits, some smoke.
Tastes delicious, with about the same aromas, wonderful espresso, with slight ash notes.
Medium, creamy mouthfeel, with a soft carbonation.
Finishes smooth, roasty, quite dry, with coffee, wood, cocoa.

Really tasty. Wonderful espresso notes, strong, but very smooth to drink. Completely worth the ratings, one of the best Porters Ive had so far!

500ml bottle at home shared with Saglopur. black color, very big coffee-colored head. Bottled 05/2014, BB 05/2017. smells smoked, roast notes, milky, spices, earthy, light sweetness, caramel. full body, light carbonation, slick creamy mouthfeel. tastes malty roasty, coffee, ash, creamy, chocolate, light sweetness, light dried fruits, some earthy notes. finishes with coffee and creamy smoky notes. wow, great beer, taste is very nice, very nice creamy mouthfeel with some subtle smoke notes.

the aroma of caramel, toast, dried fruits and spicy grasses... the taste of caramel, toast and chocolate with some notes of coffee, dark fruits and spices... the aftertaste is sweet, bitter, spicy and dry...
Black with very little head. Coffe. Dark chocolate. Smoke,malt. Fresh mouthfeel. Tastes a litte like a guinness. Was a little sceptical, but this os a very good porter!

Bottle 50cl / Botella 50cl.
@ Cervezorama 2.0.
A: Dark brown / Marron oscuro.
T/S: Roasted malt, chocolate, sweet, coffee / Malta tostada, chocolate, dulce, cafe.
Bottle at home. Pours black with big brown head. Aroma of chocolate, coffee, a little alcohol. Taste bitter-sweet with dry finish from roasted malts.

Full bodied and smooth. Always a pleasure. Rates up there with the very best porters. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Piana drobna, brązowa, bardzo trwała. Ładnie koronkuje. 
W aromacie dość wytrawne. Pachnie śliwkami i trochę deserowa czekoladą. Lekkie nuty chmielu, trochę ziołowe. W całości aromatu dają lekko likierowy aromat. 
W smaku znów czekolada, dość wytrawna, choć czuć trochę słodkich nut. 
W odczuciu nie jest bardzo pełne mimo tego ekstraktu. 
Lekko zaznaczony alkohol, trochę drapie w przełyku.

Bottle. Opaque black liquid with small to medium light tan head. Aroma of coffee, light chocolate, light ash, toast, dried fruit, raw sugar and bread. Taste is light sweet and light to medium bitter with notes of coffee, chocolate, licorice and biscuit. Medium to full bodied with medium carbonation. Pretty decent if a bit roasted for the style.
500ml bottle. Pours thick and impenetrable black with a thick tan head. Dried fruit aroma, taste is coffee and dried fruit. Didnt quite live up to the hype but very good
Bottle from Beer Dock, Crewe. Pours sludge black brown with tan head. Some coffee, hoppy, smooth.. Dark fruit. Decent, like a black IPA.

Bottle from Oddbins Beer Shop, Blackheath. Black pour with a light tan head. Chocolate raisin, black cherry, woodsmoke and chocolate aroma. Flavours of dark roast coffee, bonfire toffee, dark chocolate, raisin and black treacle. Exceedingly smooth. Dry, roasty finish. Lovely stuff!
Black with dense tan head... aromas of dried fruit and roasted malts... tastes chocolate, heavy roasted, dried fruits... medium sweet. Good solid robust porter.

Pours deep dark with medium compact brown head. Nose is slightly hoppy. Aromas are roasted malts, coffee, caramel and some chocolate. Oily texture, low carbonation. Medium sweet finish. Okay, but I expected more.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at Ølhus Kobenhavn. Black color, beige head. Bitter taste with coffee, roasted malts, hops, chocolate, licorice and nuts. Bitter finish with nuts, coffee, roasted malts, licorice and a bit of hops. Excellent porter.

Kolor czarny, czarny jak ...
Piana na bogato, solidna, z drobnymi p?cherzykami, kolor jasno br?zowy, przypomina troch? mus czekoladowy. 
W szkle pozostaje wystarczaj?co d?ugo by móc nacieszy? si? jej kolorem i faktur?. 
Aromat to po prostu poezja, palone s?ody, lekko w?dzone, oczywi?cie kawa, karmel, troch? ?ywicy, 
?liwki suszone i sma?one, rum, ale te? delikatna kwaskowato?? herbaciana, gorzka czekolada. 
W smaku podobnie jak w aromacie mamy wyra?n? czarn? kaw?, gorzk? czekolad?, delikatne nuty rumu, ?liwki. 
W czasie degustacji towarzyszy nam odrobina kwaskowato?ci tym razem jakby owocowa, W smaku nuty w?dzone jak i ?ywiczne s? nieznaczne. Bardzo ciekawe jest to, ?e ka?dy ?yk przynosi inne wra?enia smakowe. Goryczka satysfakcjonuj?ca, nie zalega, pyszna. Generalnie ca?e piwo jest bardzo smaczne. 
Porter z Nøgne Ø jest do?? ter?ciwy i t?usty, do tego stopnia, ?e w szkle nie pozosta? ?lad po pianie (nawiasem mówi?c, w szkle nie zosta?o nic :D), alkohol bardzo dobrze ukryty, ca?o?? idealnie zbalansowana.
Bottle at home. Pours black, nose is sugary, chocolate, taste is sweet chocolate, dry, quite fizzy.
From tap. Black with a beige head. Aroma and flavour of roasted malt, licorice, coffee, chooclate, caramel, bread and dried fruit.

(Nøgne Ø Porter) Bottle 500 ml served into a snifter. ABV 7%
Black colour on the body, tall and very thick brown head, with great retention, leaving heavy lacing behind as it collapses.
Aroma of roasted malts. chocolate, some fruity notes.
Tastes good, again roasted malts, hops, chocolate. Fruity finish.
Medium body, above average carbonation.
Very good.

500ml bottle at Bierhof, Athens. Black color with beige brown head. Light roasted malty aroma, coffee, light grassy hoppy. Sweet and bitter taste, earthy coffee, some chocolate, light bready. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

Aroma: Liquorice, hint of coffee (espresso), malt, roast Appearance: Dark brown, almost no see through, little yeast, off white light beige medium staying head, fine foam, light lace Taste: Coffee, liquorice, roast, light dry light bitter finish. best porter till now...
50cl bottle thanks to ruigo. Thank you for this beast! Dark color. Head is too thin. Medium bitterness. Aroma is chocolate, coffee, roasted, light hop.

50cl fles via 8 Zaligheden, Maastricht
Alcoholpercentage van 7%
Uitgeschonken in Leffe glas

Uiterlijk: zwart met redelijke cremelaag

Aroma en smaak: chocolade, geroosterde mouten, koffie, kleine bitterheid, caramel, zoetje in nasmaak

Conclusie: zoete tonen in de porter, wel aparte smaak, bitterheid valt mee 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Amazing porter. Well structured, with strong choccolate upfront in the nosing. Its almost like someone is throwing dark choccolate powder at your nostrils. Cream, vanilla ice cream at first...salted liquirice in the backgroud. Extremely creamy and well structured, had a second bottle after the first one.

BOTTLE. Batch#1074. Pours lack with little very quickly disappearing tan head. Burnt chocolate malt on the nose. Chocolate malt upfront, cocoa finish with a very creamy texture. Source cellarbrations at Capel

Bottle 0.5l. Pours black with a very pleasant brownish head. Im not getting much of an aroma, hints of chocolate, maybe the chili stout I hade before this ruined something in my nose. Taste is sweet with some bitterness, a little licorice and chocolate in there. Very pleasant mouthfeel, although a bit thin body.

This beer pours a very dark brown with a huge, frothy light brown head that persists, and the aroma blends dark chocolate, lightly roasted coffee beans, raisins, plums, and toffee. The taste blends a mild sweetness, slight bitterness, and a slight umami with an aftertaste that has a definite fruity sweetness to it, much like chocolate covered raisins and raspberries. The palate has a lively carbonation (that is almost too much), medium body, and a slick texture.

Bottle, 500ml. Almost opaque brown with a frothy brown head. Sweet, spicy roasted aroma with hints of pepper, lactose, dried fruits, chocolate. Medium to robust bodied with moderate carbonation. Sweet and bitter. Tremendous dark malt and chocolate character. Well balanced and well brewed, with a great chocolate aftertaste. Rich, warming and complex. One of the better porters Ive come across.

Thanks to my secret santa for this one. Its dark, a little syrupy. A crisp and assertive aroma, coffee, whole wheat bread. Taste is terrific. This beer has the bold flavors and complexity you normally see in higher-abv stouts and porters. Great.

Pours coffee brown with not too much head. Nose has red berries, burnt malt and chocolate. Coffee, chocolate and juice-like bitterness and sourness. Some notes of alcohol still remain, might be better a bit older. A nice and slightly different porter.
How: Bottle. Appearance: Black with tan head.. Aroma:chocolate, roasted coffee . Palate: full bodied, nice long finish
0,5l bottle. Black, small caramel head. Aroma of caramel and licorice. Mild. Roasty, bitter, dark. Good porter. Now I need to figure out the difference between porters and stouts...
UPDATED: FEB 4, 2015 Good porter, but everything is standard, coffee and some chocolate aroma and flavor

BOTTLE 50 CL. The aroma is not exactly mind-blowing - fruit sweetness (sweet, but in a fresh way, no caramel, no dried fruit), some black malt warmth (again, not extreme, no coffee) and possibly a touch of smoke. The flavour, on the other hand, is quite rich. Again, fresh fruity sweetness, soft black malts, moderate hop bitterness with a touch of acidity and some light astringency that spices things up. An excellent porter.
Bottle bbe 12.5.2017. Extremely foamy, big fluffy head. Aroma quite mild, molasses. Taste sweet, dark chocolate, slightly roasty. High carbonation cuts the sweetness. Tasty, but doesn't stand out.
Bonne porter de caractère. Qui développe de bons arômes de cacao et de caramel, on tend vers une stout tout en restant un peu plus délicate. Cest très bien.

Draught at BrewDog Camden on 9 Apr 2012. Poured black, with a dense tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, light ash, leather and earth. Liquorice in the flavour, with coffee and dark chocolate. Medium to full mouthfeel. Finish was burnt malt, treacle and oak.

50cl bottle.Dark brown colour with a nice tan head. Dark malts, dried fruit and smoke in the aroma. Soft to average carbonation and medium body. Taste is bitter with some light sweetness and dryness in the finish. Overall, a very good beer.

Bottle, 500mL. Home. Batch 853A. Brewed on August, 2012. A pitch black beer with a big beige head. Great retention. Aroma of caramel, roast, smoke, peat, coffee, alcohol. Medium sweet, light refreshing bitter. Medium body, silky nearly oily texture, average carbonation, sweet finish with a herbal smoky note. Overall, beautiful, smoky, bittersweet. Solid.

500ml bottle: BBD 15/12/16, shared with my son in Chez Sophie, Shrewsbury on 26/11/14. Dark pour with a good tan coloured head. Semi-sweet malts in both the aroma and taste, bitter chocolate and coffee coming through with a dry, roasted maltiness in the finish. A very nice Porter in deed.

Bottle
Aroma-caramel, coffee, 
Appearance-black, cloudy, brown foam, 
Taste-lightly bitter, light sweetness, lightly sour, 
Palate-medium body, oily feel, lively, long finish, 
Overall-

UPDATED: DEC 28, 2014 Pours black with a creamy tan head that lingers for quite a while. Vinous aroma of roasted malt and dried fruit. Full body, creamy feel, soft carbonation. Taste starts off dry and spicy and has a nice woody bitterness with a long finish.

Aromas de fácil percepción pero a la vez ligeros. Sobresalen las notas a maltas tostadas, ligeramente café, pero a la vez ciertas notas herbales del lúpulo utilizado.

En cuanto a su apariencia, color Negro con destellos rubíes, cuerpo medio, corona de espuma abundante de buena retención. Carbonatacion baja.

En boca es suave, cremosa y destacan ciertas notas ahumadas.

Al paladar es una porter en todo el sentido de la palabra. Suave al primer trago, ciertas notas a café y maltas tostadas, buen equilibrio entre un dulzor inicial y un amargor final ligeramente más marcado. Sin embargo destacan principalmente notas ahumadas que dan un buen final a la cerveza.

En conjunto es una excelente porter. Muy rica y fácil de tomar, no permitiendo que se perciban sus 7%.

Black beer with a small head. A real dark ashtrayish stingy aroma. Dark malts, smokey, rye bread, hops. Taste is dark smoked malts with a hop kick, some ashtray. Mouthfeel is fullish, finishes bitter. A porter with a kick this is. Not very drinkable one either, takes a while to get this one down.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draught @ Wildeman, Amsterdam.
Textbook porter, true to it's nature. No funny business, just a good øl' porter.
Very sessionable despite 7% ABV.
Bottle at home, 19th October 14. Pours black, little head, aroma, some smoke, tobacco. Taste is smoke, a little burnt some coffee, few metallic notes. Quite nice
"a robust and smooth porter with a nice hearty roasty aroma and a large dose of coffee in the flavor. far above the average porter...nice head retention, lingering finish. served warm. quite good."

500ml bottle. Pitch black with a low tan head. Chocolate, cocoa and a hint of roasted elements.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

500ml bottle served in a tulip glass.
A: Pours a dark brown color forming a solid and creamy tan head. Great retention and lots of spotty lingering lacings formed and left in the glass
S: Delicious roasted malts, coffee and chocolate notes. A bit sweet and a bit metallic too. Strong notes of floral hops. Great balance. A bit booze
T : Follows the nose. Slightly sweet upfront. Excellent notes of roasted malts. Notes of dark chocolate and coffee. Great bitter-sweet balance. Nice bitter sting in the end. Bitterness is mainly made of roasted malts but also mixed with grassy hops. A bit of metallic sensation. Brown bread yeasts profile
M: Creamy full bodied beer. Medium carbonation. Bittersweet roasted aftertaste
O: Great drinkability. Excellent beer. Extremely well-done. Scandinavian classic
[ BA Review @ 11/8/2013 ]

Bottle. Brewtique, Macclesfield. Clear, dark ruby red. Halo of tan head. Chocolate raisins. Cocoa powder. Light smoke. Taste is bonfire toffee sweet. Ashy dry. Light bitter. Palate is smooth, rich, although a little over carbonated. Finishes ashy dry, and cocoa sweet.
Kjøpt på vinmonopolet på Hønefoss. Svart med høyt lys brunt skum. Lukter søt lakris og litt kaffe. Smak av kaffe og sjokolade med en lang og søt avslutning.

500 ml bottle

A gift left over from a previous tasting, the Nogne Porter has held up well for the couple of months that it lingered. That said, I would not try to cellar it for too long or the flavors are likely to break down. Drink it fresh and youll experience a nice European interpretation of the style.

Aroma / Appearance - A fluid black base creeps from bottle to glass with a lazy motion. Reddish edges and a smooth cocoa head add nice contrast. After just a few seconds little head remains. Raspberry, chocolate, coffee, and ash waft upwards with a focus.

Flavor / Palate - The bubbly mouthfeel tastes like a melted truffle reformed into a ball. Both sweet and dry, the texture transitions to a smoky finish. The coffee taste binds together the other flavors from the first sip to the final drop. An affordable import provided a good opportunity to reacquaint myself with Nognes skills.
On tap at la cerveteca Barcelona. Aroma has chocolate coffee and hops. Small dense off white head. Taste has chocolade and hops. Nice but palate shows too much co2. That doesnt make it eaay to drnk

Bottle from Stockmann in Tallinn ( 5,95), Sept 2014; BB 28.05.2016; batch 975. Pours a dark mahogany brown, while appearing black in the glass, with a tan head that retains and laces nicely. Nose is deep coffee roastiness, dark plums and some nice Centennial coming through. Taste is roasty and somewhat chocolaty with a mild hoppy bitterness in the background. Body is around medium, carbonation very low, texture somewhat oily, finish dry and malty. Definitely a good one, but somehow fails to impress...

It has beautiful aroma of dark chocolate and tanned breads skin. Its pitch black, non-transparent, with huge head. I think its a little bit over-carbonated. It looks so and gives the mouth feeling as well. Except that, in the mouth its super smooth, thick and dense. In taste its also chocolate, a bit malty, with dark tanned bread notes. Its perfectly balanced. Leaves strong, dark and bitter aftertaste. Great porter!

UPDATED: SEP 1, 2014 
Rich pallet. Velvet smooth. Black strong color. Not bitter but well balanced. Definitely worth trying.

(50 cl bottle from Heinemann Gardermoen; Batch #1093D; Bottled on December 19th 2013; BBD: December 19th 2016) Pours black with two finger, tan head. Decent retention and beautiful lace. Aroma is subtly toasted with herbal hop notes. Smooth, oily texture, soft carbonation, medium body and a lingering, dry finish. Flavour is really smooth and mostly toasted malt with connotations of drinking liquid chocolate or coffee. Very pleasant.

Pyszny porter, nie ma co sie przygladac i pod swiatlo sprawdzac. Bo to czern nieprzepuszczajaca promieni, wielka ciemno bezowa piana wyrasta jak drozdze w piekarniku. Jest srednio trwala. Alkoholu sie nie wyczuwa, ale za to wspaniale smakowalo z Belgijskimi truflami. Sporo akcentow czekolady gorzkiej, deserowej. Troche kakao, bardzo polecam bo to dobry i uczciwy porter.

Pours a black brew with a big brown head with regular retention, aroma is moderate sweet and moderate to heavy bitter with dark chocolate, caramel, roasted malt and cofee, medium to light bodied, smooth, flavor is moderate to heavy bitter and moderate sweet with a bitter finish and a long aftertaste, very good porter,very drinkable.

roasty, chocolate, citrus, herbs, dough, raisin, black, cloudy, brown foam, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, umami, full body, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish, 

Nögne ö succeds to make a good but abit to strong porter

Bottle, stored two years. Black, tan head. Aroma has roasted malt, hints of smoke, ground coffee. Flavour is full bodied, round, smooth, with dark fruit, sweet coffee. Perfectly balanced bitterness. Long, sticky finish.

19 April 2014. Purchased from Gooden in Taipei. Opaque brown-black with fine beige head and lots of lacing. Smells strongly of coffee with some malt and ripe fruit and smoke in the background. Tastes more acidic than the aroma, burnt roasted malts with some very bitter hop and coffee to balance. Body is a bit watery but has nice fizzy carbonation. A great porter.
Fantastic... There are red fruits over a roasted coffee base. Its like a choco fruit cake. Cake, fruit, then cake again. Amazing

Bottle. Aroma smoke, roasted, alcohol. Clear dark brown colour. Taste is malt-centered, but there is decent supporting bitterness. Smoked, chocolate, light light coffee. Overall smooth mouthfeel, no astringency, very easy drinking. Very good beer, long roasted finish.
Bortimot svart farge med beige skum. Lukter kaffe, karamell og svisker. Fyldig og nydelig i munnfølelse. Kaffe og fruktigheten kommer godt fram i smaken. Fin bitter avslutning. En meget god porter.

Draft to taster at Ei8ht Ball. Looks good; a cloudy dark cola with off-white lacing. Smells sold; dark malt, chocolate, and caramel. Tastes like it smells, but more roasty than sweet. Solid on the palate with a bit of bitterness. A nice porter.

Bona cervesa, bastant equilibrada i gustosa.
Buena cerveza, bastante equilibrada y sabrosa.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Head: nice beige. Colour: ruby brown. Aroma: spicy hops, malt. Taste: light sour, medium bitter. Palate: smooth, dry, bitter finish, low CO2. Overall: very good.

Black, brown color with a small beige head. Black coffee, bready malts and a lot of smoke with hints of salt and toffee - unexpected smokiness which works exeptional well with the earthy, bitter character of this beer.

Fantastic, very unexprected taste for a Porter. Fascinating interaction between bitter coffee and earthy, bready malts, coated up by sweet toffee hints. On top of that, there is a gentle smokiness wich adds a fantastic complexity to the beer, along with a chewy salt infusion. Those different tastes are in perfect balance, which leads to a enjoyable, complex, warm Porter with a soft, smooth mouthfeel. Unexpected bitter for a beer of this style, but very convincing, with smokiness acting as the cherry on top.

Aroma: Lemon, Leather, Cereal, Dark chocolate.
Appearance: Black, Medium tan head.
Taste: Sour beginning moving to Sweet Chocolate middle and a roast finish. 
Palate: Smooth, medium bodied, mild carbonation with a slight bitter finish.
Overall: Smooth, rich porter. Nice.

Fine example of a porter. Almost black with a good head and lacing, medium bodied with just the right amount of carbonation. Roasted malts arrive first on the nose, and mingle with milky coffee and chocolate in the taste. The tang of the fruit comes at the finish to round it off very nicely.

This beer is dark brown, almost black, ruby red against the light. The head is mocha colored, persistent and huge, leaving lacing. Aroma has chocolate, roasted malts, toffeey sweetness, latte coffee and some licoricy saltiness. Flavor is upfront roasted malty with coffee and bitterness. Palate is thicker than medium and soft with stinging bitterness. Finishes with heavy bitterness, ashy roastiness and acidic coffee. Alcohol heats but doesnt taste or reek at all. A totally enjoyable porter that could also go for an American style Stout. BBE says this is 13 months old but the hops still make a great bitterness and it has not gone bad.

UPDATED: AUG 6, 2014 Chocolate, coffee, dark malts notes, wood and dried fruits aroma. Dark brown color, with medium tan head, persistent lacing. Medium to full body, smooth and creamy. Coffee, chocolate, wood, dried fruits, malt, yeast. Balanced between the sweetness and the bitterness. An incredible porter.

Bottle 50 cl.
Pours dark brown to black, with full tan head. Aroma of malt, cocoa, and some hops. Medium sweet, light bitter.
Black with big light brown head. Blackcurrant, smoked and roasted malts, chocolate, red berries. Medium bodied with slightly thin feel. Nice complex porter.

Bottle, 500 ml. Pours jet black with about a finger of tan head. Nice amount of lacing. Big roasted malt presence on the nose, with notes of wholemeal bread, sweeter varieties dark chocolate and a small amount of coffee. Little bit of alcohol but by no means enough to be a detriment. Taste of wholemeal bread, dark chocolate, chocolate cake, and again that big roasted malt presence, with perhaps a small caramel note. Decent amount of bitterness on the back end and a moderate level of alcohol warmth. Low carbonation and a silky smooth mouth feel. Really quite impressed by this one!

Bitter charcoal aroma with some dark dried fruits. Smooth, easy to drink. A very fruity taste with some hints of blackcurrant amongst the bitter, roasted malts. Very full flavoured but also very easy to drink.
Bottle: Very dark brown color, foamy brown head. Aroma is intensive malty and roasty, dark chocolate, sweet cacao. Flavor is roasty, caramelic, dark chocolate, cacao beans, toffee. Very good.

Nøgne Ø Porter is tasty and nicely balanced. Aroma is moderate chocolate and roasty. Pour is very dark brown with a tan head. The roasty and chocolate notes come through again in the taste with the slightly higher ABV evening the flavors out. Definitely give this porter a swig if you get a chance.

Bottle: Served in a Chouffe glass:
Medium sized mocha colored foamy head on top of a black colored beer.
Aromas of roast, coffee, malt roast, rye, some coal, some brown sugars and a hint of flower roast.
Flavours of coffee, darker chocolate, malt roast, bitters, roast, some hay roast, hint of herbs and some hints of prunes and brown sugars.
Aftertaste is a mix of roast, bitters, hay, some coffee and a sprinkle of brown sugars...
Low carbo, creamy mouthfeel, medium to fuller bodied and a creamy texture.
Like a porter should be.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Bottle from Gooden Taipei. Light black pour with fluffy tan head. Sticky lacing. Coffee and chocolate aroma. Flavor is bright hops at the beginning then roasted coffee flavor. Very nice to have such hoppiness in this sort of porter. Palate is a bit lighter than ideal for this type of beer I think. Dry bitter finish with a bit of coffee and booze. Very nice porter.

Bottle. Pours cloudy very dark brown with rocky but stable light tan head. Dark aroma of coffee, chocolate, malt and liquorice. Dark flavour of malt, dark chocolate and coffee. Sweetish aftertaste with notes of coffee beans. Very nice.

Pours dark brown, almost black with pretty beige head. Aroma is dark chocolate, roasted malt and dark bread. Flavour is chocolate, roasted and medium bitter. Certainly this must be one of the nicest porters out there.

Ein feines Nogne und ein feines Porter dazu. Mild, mit Anteilen von Rosinen, ein wenig Kaffee und geröstetem Malz. Cremig in der Konsistenz und mild in der Perlung. Kein verrücktes, aber eins mit Klasse. Daumen hoch.

Bottle from trade with Meilby - thank you so much, for it, Kenni! The beer pours out in a deep black colour with low head and smooth body. Aroma of chocolate and malt. Taste of malt, roasted barley, nuts, torf, chocolate, coffee and dark berries. Dry finish with some nice and gentle roast aromas. Enjoyed it.

Pitch Black. Totalnie nieprzejrzyste. Piana ładna aczkolwiek dość szybko uległa redukcji, ładnie oblepia szkło. W aromacie palona kawa i czekolada, zarazem kwasek czuć od kawy.
W smaku kremowe ale bez nadmiaru ciała, średnio w stronę wysokiego wysycenia.

Pours a dark brown, looks black in the glass. Large fluffy tanned head. Aroma is rich malts and subtle roast. Nuts, almonds and a sweet bready note, hints of chocolate as well. Taste is well balanced, malt-driven but perfectly rounded with the bitter hops. Medium body and carbonation.
Bottled. Overall watery for my taste with a low body. Nice porter characteristics no doubt. Some tasty sweet fruit backbone. Bitter chocolate finish. Alcohol warming. Pretty good.
Ok. Aroma Is Charcoal. Dark black pour, slightly creamy looking head. Taste is Coffee, Ash. Disappointing. A bit distracted while drinking, so maybe have to try again in future.

(small gusher) pours unclear very dark brown with a creamy tall frothy light beige head, good retention and lacing - almost abnormal. roastiness-plenty, some burnt malts, slightly ashy, ground coffee - roasted acidity, raisins and chewy dark red fruits, very spicy too - coriander and other stuff, hint of wood and vanilla. lively and foamy carbonation - disturbing, light to medium body, medium long bitter coffee-spicy-piney finish. bottle conditioning issue. still.. very nice stuff.

23/III/14 - 50cl bottle from De Hopduvel (Gent) @ home - BB: 8/X/16, brewed: 8/X/13 (or 2012?) (2014-306) 
Clear dark brown to black beer, creamy irregular beige head, little stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: dark chocolate, roasted, bit smoky, overripe fruits. MF: ok carbon, medium to full body. Taste: pretty bitter start, mocha and coffee, little sour, smoky. Aftertaste: bitter, smoky, coffee, cacao powder, dark chocolate, very smoky, bitter hops.

500ml bottle from Vinmonopolet. Medium creamy brown head which fades quickly. Good lacing. Solid black body. Aroma is alcohol, dark fruits, coffee, cocoa and malt. Some spiciness as well. Mostly sweet on the tongue with a slightly bitter aftertaste. Roasted malt. Feels a little watery throughout the bottle
Drank from a bottle at a bar. Strong but smooth porter. Theres maybe some coffee in the taste.
UPDATED: SEP 2, 2016 Belle couleur noire; arômes et goût torréfiés; jolie finale douce-amère; une bonne bière

UPDATED: MAY 26, 2016 Brown 0,5L bottle abv7%, beige head, knitwork of lacings, about black body.
Scents of cocoa, mocca coffee, leather, liquorice, dried apple, some grassy fresh stuff.
Tastes dark chocolate malts, mocca juice, notes of sweet liquorice, cocoa cream. 
Slightly flourish on palate, nice body, smooth carbonation.
Finishes still with chocolate malts, dried fruity notes, lingering.
This drink goes well as evening sipper, with dark confectionery, 
cheese, or even as replacement for red wine to red meat dishes. Easy to enjoy overall.
 #1055 TAP231013 BBF23oct16 [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */

Barwa: ciemna, nieprzejrzysta. Piana beżowa, drobno pęcherzykowa. Początkowo obfita, dość szybko opada, ale ładnie oblepia szkło.

Aromat: ciemne słody, kawa, czekolada gorzka, owoce, lekki chmiel.

Smak: na początku słodowa i owocowa słodycz oraz czekolada. Po chwili następuje jednak wytrawna palona i kakwowa kontra.

Z pewnością ciekawe piwo, jedynie nieco zbyt wytrawne na końcu.
Poured from bottle, black with tan head. Huge aromas of coffee and fruit with roasted malts. Taste is dark chocolate and coffee. Smooth with a little bitterness. Very good porter.

Bottle from Amstein - Black color, small but good lasting brown head - aroma of cacao, dark chocolate, mocha - flavor of cacao, bitter dark chocolate, roasted malt - Medium/full body, creamy, medium bitterness, medium carbonation, bitter dark chocolate finish - this is really good a porter
10/14/2011. From bottle. Dark brown with a beige head. Roasted malt aromas with chocolate, caramel, spices. Very nice balance, bitter, robust and a bit of coffee showing on the finish.

Aroma: coffee, chocolate, roasted malt flavours. Appearance: black, beige medium head. Taste: light sweet. Palate: massive chocolate and roasted coffee notes, light bitterness coming up. Overall: great Porter, very nice in both aroma and palate. Bottle from Beer Hawk, England.
500ml black bottle. Unfiltered. Christmas gift from my son. He chose well, and put together a nice package. This is a lovely easy drinking and tasty beer. I enjoyed every drop and would like more.

Pours dark brown, opaque, with a massive caramel head. Aroma is malted chocolate and coffee with a tad of earthiness. Not as slick or thick on the tongue like I expected. Tastes of dark chocolate and coffee with a nice smooth aftertaste. This is like a stout without the backend bitterness. Excellent porter!

Bottle pours black with a thick brown head. Aroma is revealing distinct dark roasted coffee and chocolate appearance, with a earthiness in the background. Taste is of medium sweetness and gives of a good salty and bitterness in the end that leaves a good feeling for a long time. Texture of the beer is creamy, but not too thick, and the carbonation is lively enough to make this beer a pleasure to drink. Finish is long, perfect! Good balanced beer, thumbs up!

0,5L bottle, BB 08.2016. Pours black with huge tan head. The head stays, very nice lacing. Aroma is coffee, dark chocolate, fruits, and caramel. Taste is sweet with coffee bitterness, fruits, dark chocolate. Alcohol is really well hidden and is only faint burn. Finish is coffee bitter with some smoke. Overall: really nice sweet and fruity porter, really smooth for the ABV.

50 cl. bottle, batch # 853 B. Black with a reddish hue and a dense, tanned head. Roasted aroma with fruits, bitter chocolate, coffee, caramel and hard roasted malts. Light hints of smoke and liquorice. Taste is light bitter. Medium body with a creamy texture and a soft carbonation. Finishes bitter with coffee and chocolate. Excellent Porter.

Bottle. Pours black with very nice beige head. Full body. Aroma: chocolate, roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, chocolate some dried fruits Taste: the same like aroma, a lot of chocolate, roasted malts, praline and some dried fruits. Dessert beer, quite sweet.

Huge brownish head with light malt aromas. Body is black like oil. Taste shows delicate malt and roasted chocolate. Sweet balance. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at home (batch #1043, 08-10-13). Pours dark with a tan head. Aroma of roasted malts, smoke, and hops. Taste of roasted, almost burned, malts, some hops, long lasting smoky to burned aftertaste. Drinkable, but a bit too burned for my taste, definitely not my favorite.

Bottle - BBE Aug 2013, Drank Mar 2013 - BCA; heavily sedimented. Black in colour. Very malty; roast malts, espresso coffee, dark chocolate, caramel. Fruity; dried fruit. Hoppy; earthy hops. English ale yeast. Smooth. Nice malt/fruit/hop balance. Very enjoyable. Lovely Porter!
500ml Flasche. Ins Glas ergießt sich ein schwarzes Bier mit schöner bräunlichen Schaumkrone. Geruch sehr röstmalzig, Schokolade, Kaffee. Geschmack röstmalzig, Kaffee, Schokolade, leicht fruchtig.

Deep chestnut brown color, light brown head. Bitter chocolate nose, milk chocolate, roasted malt, hint of burnt sugar. Roasted malt taste, coffee, chocolate, hint of smoke. Sweet with a bitter finish, nice balance. Full body, medium carbonation, velvety and oily mouthfeel.

Bottle. Pours black with a tan head. Smells of roasted malts, bitter chocolate, and some coffee. Rich tastes of coffee, malts, and chocolate. Light bitter aftertaste. Almost imperial stout taste but much lighter.

Noir sombre avec un grand col marron qui reste longtemps. Larôme du chocolat, malt torréfié et fruits noir. Le goût est du chocolat, malt torréfié et fruit noir avec un très peu damertume en final. Très onctueux et un peu épais en bouche.

Bottle from Palme, many thanks my friend. Pours almost black color, huge dark beige head. Aroma of coffee, caramel, roasted malt, some dark fruits. Taste is medium bitter, coffee, cocoa, dark chocolate, caramel, roased malt. Very nice long coffee bitter finish, very good one!
Aroma is dark malts, coffee, mild peat smoke and big acidity. The flavor is dark malts, scotch notes, light coffee/chocolate, fruit and an acidic and dry finish.

Bottle batch 933. Dark brown close to black with a large beige head. Brown sugar, light hard roasted malt, light citrus, dusty, cocoa, grain. Not very big bodied, oily texture, soft carbonation. Light/medium sweet and bitter. Pleasant and easy drinking.

Fekete, mint a fekete. Illata likoros, kakaos, kaves, porkolt malata. Ize is ilyen, szepen kiegyensulyozott. Finom
.
500ml bottle. Black pour with a thick light brown head. Beer looks great. Roasted malt and chocolate smell. A sweet aftertaste that makes you want more. A very fine porter. Would love another bottle.
Very fine beer, beautiful black pour, with thining tan . Thick chocolate, with great sweet and sour balance. Very easy drinking .

(Brewed 3rd July 2006) 
Appearance: Dark, dark brown, almost black. Towards the rim brown with a reddish element, like dark caramel. Nice, lasting, beige coloured head.
Nose: Dark, sweet maltiness, sweet, medium dark honey & medium dark chocolate combined, dark roast coffee, smoke. After a while some bottle aroma develops too.
Taste / palate: Rounded, dark bitterness, a little sweetness, appealing, thick & full bodied. Medium carbonation, very small bubbles. Long aftertaste. Very well balanced.
Great 7,5 year old port!!

DAA; Pours black with creamy, lasting, lacing tan head. Nose is roasted malt, light campfire, with hoppy fruity, grassy notes, coffee, chocolate and vanilla. Taste is much the same adding sweetness, dried fruits and licorice. Medium to full bodied, oily texture with a soft carbonation. Warming with a coffee, chocolate, dry finish.

Botella de 50 cl en el lupulo. 11-01-14. Aromas hervaceos y algo tostados y cacao. Color negro intenso con espuma beige bastante persistente. Cuerpo medio con algo de gas. Sabores bastante hervaceos al principio combinados con algo de cacao y maltas tostadas. Regusto final bastante hervaceo y algo amargo. ---- Demasiado hervacea debería notarse un poco más los sabores tostados y quemados pero en general no está nada mal.

Nesten helt svart i fargen. Skummet er tynt og kremfarget, men det blir hengende lenge. Lukter karamell, kaffe og malt (og sjokolade?) Lite kullsyre, som passer denne typen bra. Bitter/søt kort ettersmak.

Flaske, batch 1012, fra Sola taxfree: højt og dannet skum. Aroma preget av mørkbrent kaffe, overristet brød og et snev av tobakk. Tørr og tydelig smak med de nevnte elementer. Ganske slank munnfølelse som elegant skjuler vitamininnholdet. Lang ettersmak. Komplementerte perfekt vår hjemmelagede fruktkake (proppet med aprikoser, rosiner, svisker og tørket fiken, dynket i spansk kvalitetsbrandy)!

Bottle @ Home. Pours black with a huge tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, light coffee, little chocolate, dark fruit, cherries. Flavor of roasted malts, coffee, chocolate, dark fruit, dates, cherries. Medium body, lively carbonation, light sweet and rather dry finish. 261213

Bottle @ Christmas at Erik og Betinna. Dark brown, medium tan head that settles nicely, nice lacing and coating. Aroma, roasted malts, chocolate, licorice, coffee, wood notes, a little alcohol. Taste, roasted malts, chocolate, dark fruits, burnt sugar, dry liquorice, . Lively carbonation. Oily mouth feel. Roasted malt aftertaste.
Bottle @ JustBeer 12/12/13. Aroma of sweet nuts. Color: black, with thin white head. Taste of complex chocolate malts. Palate is round, a bit astringent. Very good overall.
Dark brown colour huge brown head. Aroma of roasted malt, coffe, some earth and nuts, and minimal cherry. Taste is less complex, mostly roastedness and maltyness
Batch 1003. Colour is black with slightly brownish white head. Aromas and flavours: Coffee, some chocolate and roasted malts. So soft but maybe little bit of too carbonated. Overall magnificen

Black pour with average, creamy beige head that leaves some sticky lace. Nose of mint chocolate, cooked fruit and light coffee. That mint chocolate thing really sticks through on the palate and leans a little mentholly. The fruit is there as well and its more lively. The coffee is still way in the back. A little thin on the palate but overall a really interesting porter.

Sample from bottle @sbwf13. Dark brown with big tan head. Aroma of dark chocolate, toffee, dried fruit, port and honey. Taste is sweet, dark chocolate, dark fruit, plums, coffee and earthy notes. Nice

Légère explosion lors de l'ouverture et collet magistralement intense. La date indique parcontre à boire jusqu'en 2016. Bref, peut être infecté. De couleur noir avec une mousse teinté moka. Nez: légèrement acide. Pomme. Chocolat. Alcool. Bouche: beaucoup trop effervescente. Légèrement acide et métallique. Café. Chocolat noir. Mélasse. Fruit séché. Noix. Anis. Peut être un peu de bactérie sauvage (infecté) mais miniblement. Sinon on peut voir le beau produit derrière.

UPDATED: NOV 27, 2015 Denso color nero con un bel cappello di schiuma marroncino chiaro. Al naso è caffettosa e cioccolatosa con un lievi sentori tostati, al palato offre un intenso equilibrio leggermente dolciastro di cacao, caffè, malto abbrustolito e zucchero a velo. Finale conciso, mediamente persistente e non "appiccicoso"; corpo medio, effervescenza gentile, struttura setosa.

UPDATED: DEC 29, 2016 Bottle. Nose: intensive resin and dark chocolate. Mouth: coffee, dark chocolate, roasted malt, but without ash-like feeling, hops. Black colour, rocky brown head with decent lacing. Light to medium bitterness, very slight sweetness. Medium body, creamy texture, soft carbonation - altogether the beer is easy to drink. Good.
Svart i fargen med beigeskum. Sjokolade plomme. Salt lakris nellik. Lite kullsyre, fin bitter avslutning kort.

Bottled in 2011. Thin pour, black with a decent foamy white head. Smell - yeast, mustyjust very toned down and not very appetising really. Body is medium and foamy, carbonation low. Taste - raisin, dates, slight toffee. An above average, fruity porter.

Pours dark brown to black with a light brown creamy head. Aroma is roasted malts, dark chocolate, coffee, licorice, raisins. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter. Great mouthfeel, average carbonation. Long dry sweet finish with some bitterness.

Sweet, milky coffee, chocolatey aromas.

Lovely thick dark appearance, with a nice tan head that sticks around.

Bitter but not too bitter coffee notes on the initial taste. Roasty malts balanced out with a sublime chocolate sweetness. This beer is superbly balanced. 

Dense palate with a slight, pleasant carbonation. 

Very, very nice beer. Would absolutely recommend.

Bottle 0.5l at Pikkulintu, Helsinki. Brygget 23.07.2013. Best för 23.07.2016. Batch 1003. Colour is black with slightly brownish white head. Aromas and flavours: Coffee, some chocolate and roasted malts. So soft but maybe little bit of too carbonated. Overall magnificent.-- via beerbasher/winphone Lumia 800

Black with hughe light brown foam head, lacing. Aroma is coffee dominated, taste is coffee and some chocolate. good bitterness. Some toast. Nice aftertaste, went well with lamb meat and potato nudels. (Bergen 201311)

Tap at Moeder Lambic. Dark brown with medium tanned head. NOSE : black chocolate, toffee, tart, port wine, floral notes and honey. Dried plums. SIP : medium to thick body with delicate carbonation. Oily texture. Sweet flavour of black chocolate and cooked dried dark fruits. The middle is mild and dairy like. Ending gets dry and bitter like coffee. Earthy feeling on the tongue. OVERALL : mild and easy to drink. Still quite complex and tasty.
UPDATED: MAR 12, 2015 Bottle 0.5 l @ home. Pours dark with medium head. Nice! Aroma is chocolate, coffee and some hops. Taste is much the same. Nice finishing bitterness on the tongue. Excellent.

UPDATED: OCT 25, 2013 (Bottle): Pours black with a small tan head. Aroma of heavily roasted malt, dark chocolate, milky coffee, chocolate covered raisins, super malty bread. Superb taste - coffee, cocolate, roasted malt, dark fruits, doughy, milky elements, slight smokiness and much, much more. Its a rich, full bodied beer but has been reigned in to keep an amazing balance.
Bottle. Mild milkchocolate, with some faint coffee-notes. Decent porter, but maybe a tad watery.

Pours adark black with a big frothy dark brown head. Aroma is roasted malts and bitter chocolate. Taste is viscous, roasted malt and bitter chocolate. Nothing spectacular but a solid porter that I would have anytime.

På fat. Fantastiskt god. Smak och doft av humle, malt, karamell, choklad, torkad frukt med toner av läder, hallon, vanilj och laktris. Bra balans, lagom sötma, en aning vinös men väldigt välbalanserad, fruktig och med en fin beska.

UPDATED: OCT 4, 2013 (500ml) Every sip of this im trying to like this shit ,  but its boring or mundane -or without balls . Chocolate and floral hops , maybe suggesting raisin but the texture is thin and not like theres 7% booze residing in this. meh

On tap at Frisco Tap House & Brewery in Columbia, MD. 

Opaque, brown-black with a khaki head and very good lacing. 

Aroma of chocolate, roasted malt, vanilla, chocolate-raspberry, figs, sweet dates, banana, raisin and cherry. 

Taste of toasted malt, chocolate, raspberry, vanilla, dates, figs, raisins, bananas and mild floral hops. 

Full body and medium/low carbonization.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Amazing porter, perfect combination with dark chocolate (85%). Beautiful aroma: malty, coffee. Taste: gentle bitterness, Mouthfeel: silky soft. Really good example of the style.

Bomber in an english pint. Nearly black pour woth minimal dark tan head. So incredibly drinkable. Its the perfect amount of coffee flavor for my preference. Slightly more carbo than most porters, but still plenty creamy. Could have enjoyed it to be a tad richer, but its still a class beer.

500ml bottle. Very dark brown color. Medium size, off-white, thick head, stays. Deep roast, sweet, raisins, cocoa powder, coffee in aroma. Roasted malts, milky, hops, grainy, hay, dark chocolate in flavor. Well balanced. Nice one!
Draught at Moeder Lambic. Pours black with a huge brown head. Moderate to heavy roasted aroma, sweet. Flavor also moderate to heavy roasted, coffee and some notes of chocolate.

Opaque black, small brown head. Nose is roast, malt, some sweetness, tar and smoke, espresso, dark chocolate. Taste is robust roast with slightly sweet malt, licorice, coffee, more chocolate. Some bitterness and roast in the finish. Medium to full body, flat carbonation, oily, almost syrupy mouthfeel. Smooth but not thin and tasty.

Beauty of a beer. Pours a deep as night black with a huge foamy and tan head that subsides to a thin tight cap. The nose is well roasted, nutty as well as oddly fruity. Notes of molasses, chocolate and espresso are noted. A heavy robust taste with a mild bitter finish and and a nice richness. A good porter overall

Delicate roast malt and raisins aroma. Dark brown opaque beer with thick, fluffy, long-lasting light brown head. Tastes of dried fruit at first, with a touch of acidity, then progresses towards dark chocolate (more than coffee in my opinion) and perhaps ash. Quite creamy with spot on carbonation. This is a delicious quaffable porter where sweetness, bitterness and a slight alcoholic warmth balance each other perfectly.

Bottle from VM Storslett. Black with grande thick long lasting brown head. Chocolate malty aroma. Fizzy feel. Round thick taste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at serious tasting back in the day w some other heady brahs for a bud and brew pairing dinner. This was one of the first courses before we worked into the heavy and rare fun times. Poured a black color with smaller head and lace. Aromas and taste were roasted coffee bean, chocolate, smoke, sweet malt, and hops. Nice toffee finish. Solid beer.

Black color, medium brown head. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, licorice and dark fruits. Taste has notes of roasted malt, dark chocolate, dark berries, it is quite sweet with gentle dryness and medium bitter hoppy finish. Medium body and average carbonation. Nice porter, very enjoyable.

Incredibly much chocolate scent. The taste is also of chocolate and roasted malt. Long aftertaste of the same. Im enjoying this beer when I drink it. Heavenly beer! Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.

On tap at Moeder Lambic. Pours pitch black with a vibrant and foamy, tan head. Notes of smokey chocolate, wood. Immediately enveloping soft and round taste of smoke and caramel, with a short sour twist and hints of blackberry. Perfectly balanced, smooth but jumpy. Good sex.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dark brown/black color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of toasted malt, caramel, coffee, & some licorice/anise notes; Flavor of roasted malt, caramel, chocolate, hops, some dark fruit, and coffee; Very nicely balanced; Solid.

Gusher! Pours black, opaque. Nose is fruitier than the typical porter and somehow they blend the grapefruit with the dark malts well. Flavour is chocolate, roast but not acrid, more grapefruit, smokey. Very nice beer.

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; black brown with big foamy beige head, coffee aroma, coffee and chocolate comes through in the taste a hint of sweetness, some bitterness, quite slick mouthfeel, excellent stuff.

Bottle. Dark brown body, tall beige head. Aroma has mild coffee roast. Mildly astringent taste with watery coffee and some hops. Alcohol well covered. Sourish finish. Just a regular porter, nothing impressive. Why the fascination here?
Black-Brown pour with billowy tan head. Nose is only slightly roasted malts, chocolate. Notes of Coffee, Chocolate, Raisins, Caramel, Toasted Malts. Soft body. Mild Velvety Finish.

Black appearance with brown head. Aroma is leather, bourbon, coffee and dark chocolate. Rich mouthfeel with over-average carbonation. Aftertaste is dry with some floral hops and loads of cocoa and coffee. Overall: Very good!
Bottle. Color black with medium brown head. Aroma malt, roasted, chocolate, light smoke. Taste roasted, alcohol, chocolate.
Black, some dark foam. Low carbonation. Full body. Aroma of roasted malts, dark fruit and coffee. Long bitter aftertaste.

From a 500ml bottle on 18/8/2013 (batch number 648, BB 26/6/2016). Pours a very dark brown with a small head. Has a very pleasant sweet chocolate aroma, with a touch of dark fruit. Milk and dark chocolate dominate the flavour, with some prunes and raisins, a bit of soy sauce, and a mild roasty bitterness. Has a medium body and typical carbonation for the style. A lovely sweet porter.
Poured dark brown with a frothy, disappointing beige head. Aroma of roast malt. light coffee notes. Medium body, flavour of sweet mocha, burnt malt and dark fruit. Bitter sweet finish.
Notes of vanilla and caramel on the nose. Very smooth, light bodied, slightly bitter notes of roasted malts, but not too bitter. Fine bubbles, low carb, low head, slightly creamy.

Quand une bière jaillit dès louverture, je me lance dans un chapelet de sacres et je cherche désespérément à ne pas en mettre partout. Alors, cette norvégienne me fait le coup et ce nest pratiquement que de la mousse que je récupère. Sinon, elle est brune opaque. Un nez de grains grillé et de poussière. Un goût de mélasse acidulée, danis, du moins, de bonne réglisse noire. Un alcool qui se tient proche, sans chercher à voler la vedette. Avec le calme revenu, je suis parvenu à la trouver intéressante. (722-030713)

500 ml bottle. Pours a very dark brown with huge overflowing head (a bottle gusher). Aromas of dry dark coffee, ash, and roasted malts. Flavors of dark chocolate, chicory, nuts, and some dark fruit. A little hot and other than the gusher, a very nice porter.
On tap. Dark colour with beige head. Chocolate aroma, fresh hoppiness, roastness. Roasted taste, also cohocolate and hops, slightly acid. Medium body.

500ml bottle. Pours black with a foamy beige head. The nose is earthy notes, with coffee, cocoa, a light mint note, molasses, faint red licorice, and some definite booze. Medium bodied with some light dried fruit up front, lots of mouth drying bitter black coffee notes, light hit of sweetness, faint ash, light menthol, a strong taste that really reminds me of extra strength Fishermans Friends lozenges, and molasses and coffee in a huge finish that goes on forever. For something this light in body to have this much flavour is seriously impressive. It might have the biggest finish of any beer Ive had.

500 ml bottle poured into a brandy snifter. Pours a dark brown with a darker beige head of foam. Aroma is roast and ash. Burnt malt. Taste is dry ashes, kind of like a puff on a re-lit cigar. More pleasant than that, but similar. As it warms, notes of vanilla and milk chocolate start to come out. Dont drink this too cold, or youll miss out on a nice beer.

Bottle. Batch #783, bottled 30/03/12, BBE 30/03/15. Pours a dark cola brown, almost black with a small, mocha-colored head. Aroma is heaps of roast, quite a bit of liquorice too. Lightly salty liquorice. When swirled around a strong aroma of dark, dry, Finnish rye bread comes to the nose, along with large helpings of coffee. Very strong, becoming almost overpowering and barnyard-like. Taste is very dry with a lot of roast with some liquorice. Strong presence of dark coffee, very roasty, a bit ashy even. Some grapefruity hops on the finish with a light touch of wood. Surprisingly light with enough carbonation. Very easy to drink. Just... superb.

Deep dark body with huge bubbly head. Thick chocolate, bit of cacao, roasted malts, clean yeast and forest hops. Awesome start.
