Beginning is light sweet a d roasted, tantalising on the tongue, flowing into a stronger bitterness with perfect ending thats drinkable yet lasting. Dry base though with pleasant carbonation. Spot on brew, really, faultless and tasteful. And in a bit indulging bottle. Love it. (50cl bottle from Bière Révolution)

Im not all convinced, but its surely a great beer - especially with this spareribs meal I drank it alongside. Lots of coffee and some darker fruits and berries in it, but I miss some heavyness and real character. Well-balanced and soft and enjoyable.

Dark, dark brown, small latte coloured head. Smells.. Chocolate, malt, some licorice, some hop hints and coffee too. Tastes..nice choc malts, mild dark fruits and coffee hints. Nice long bitter after taste. Good.
Nogne porter is an intense ride on the porter train! Deep earthy aroma, coffee amd chocolate tones. Full on the palate. A beer to be sipped by the fire on a cold night. Not a great bbq beer.

Huge, five finger, overflowing, head!! Pours black with big lacing. Head fades but lasts forever. Smell is roasty with a hint of chocolate. Taste is a great roasted flavour. Chocolate, coffee, and notes of liquor. Nice medium body. A bit creamy. Medium carbonation. Very nice!

On tap at Taps in Petaluma. Pours a dark brown color with frothy head. Full of flavor an very thick for a porter. Some harshness that tastes a little by tannic. Also a little bourbony but don't think it's barrel aged.

Pours dark, dark, very dark with reddish tones, medium beige tan top, medium lasing. First aroma - was very intense dark chocolate, spicy, mild sweet one. More deeper more roasted malt (medium intense)with hints of dried fruit or raisin on nose, no sugary or lactic, well balanced aroma. When top is at high aroma tends to be light creamy; almost no hops. On late stages of consuming it becomes more to sweet dark, dried or whatever fruit side. Taste - light sweet with good bitter from mostly dark malt, hops are more in aftertaste medium herbal bitter, minimal sour (in a good way). Palate - medium body, creamy-slicky texture, almost none carbonated to me, long, bitter-herbal and light creamy sweet finish. Mild flavor, so this to me is not robust porter although fruit tones was pleasantly intense-spicy. Very pleasant sample. Could be more visual performance,
Draft at Kraftwork. Pours a deep brown, near black, with small beige head and light lace. Nose of roasted malt, chocolate, caramel, brown sugar. Medium body, light carbonation. Average porter.

Clear deep dark brown with medium brownish head.
Aroma.. deep roasted malts decent hops, chocolate, bit caramel. Quite spicy
Sweetish with nice bitterness. Dry
Very good balance. This is an example how porter should taste
Bottle. Dark colored beer with a beige head. Nice aroma of burned malts, old raisins and dark fruit. Nice balanced flavors. A bit chocolate, coffee, some caramel in the background. Very good one.
A great porter. Sweet and light on the tongue - yes, plenty of carbonation - with delicate tastes of berries and chocolate against burnt coffee and malts.
En god smak av sjokolade, karamell, kaffe og malt. En fin duft av karamell og bek.  Fin sort farge med et tynt skum langs kanten. En god litt søtlig etter smak av karamell og sjokolade.
Dyp svart farve med beige skum. Lukt av sjokolade, malt og bek. Smak av sjokolade, karamell,kaffe og god malt. Vinmonopolet.

This is a beauty. Bottle pours with an initial massive frothy head that lasts forever. Poured about 2/3 into glass and when I set the bottle down the remainder came flying gusher-style out of the bottle. Jet black lots of lacing. Nose is some coffee but also a hint of leather and/or tobacco. Aromas of espresso, smoky hints and some earthy hops. Tastes are light sweet and pretty heavy bitterness. Full body with very aggressive carbonation.

Bottle 50 cl, BBE 30.3.2015. Pours black in color with a creamy tan head. Roasted malty notes, a bit of 
milk chocolate and cold coffee in aroma. Roasted coffee beans, notes of cocoa and slightly bitter 
chocolate in taste. Smooth though and feels almost like quite creamy in mouthfeel. Slightly burnt, quite 
bitter and roasted notes of coffee in aftertaste.

Okay that is an insane amount of head. Ive never had a beer froth up that much when pouring down the side of a shaker. Reminds me of Caffrys. Man that smells fantastic. Lots of fruits and berrys, blackberry. This head is nuts, its not fading either. Lots of coffee in the mouth along with fruity tartness. Just a slight touch boozy with is something I love in my beers. Theres some smoked maltiness thats mainly in that insane head. Man this really is fantastic. I so wish I had bought more than one bottle.
0.5l bottle. Black body, light brown head. Aroma of black currant, cherries and chocolate. Taste of cherries, chocolate, coffee and floral/citrusy hops in the finish. Very nice beer.

Bottle. Lively pour, but opaque. Aroma is bitter chocolate and dark fruits, light roast and yeast. Chocolatey entry, with rather prominent yeasty phenols, figgy fruit, light corky yeast, dry finish. Complex, densely flavoured without feeling heavy, and despite the lively carbo during the pour, this had a lovely smooth mouthfeel. A delicious porter.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: 500ml bottle at Porterhouse Cork, courtesy of Kelvin. Lovely aroma of sweet coffee, chocolate, blackcurrant, burnt toast. Medium sweetness, light bitterness, light sourness, light smoked flavours, hugely complex and very well-rounded. Sweetish chocolate and blackcurrant finish, nice and smooth and full-bodied. Really hard to fault this one, delicious.

Pour is very dark brown with a small tan head. Aroma is dark chocolate, light coffee, smoke, and a bit of brown sugar. Taste is heavy on the roasted malts with notes of dark chocolate, burnt wood, and caramel. Finish is dry and a bit yeasty.
Extremely frothy tan head. Clinging lace. Black pour. Chocolate, fruit berry a aroma. Roasted malt flavor. Vodka hints. Smooth with an alcoholic vodka finish.

Black color with riby nuance, one finger beige head. Aroma of  dark chocolate, cocoa, nuts, some anis, some vanilla, woody notes. Taste is light sweet, light to medium bitter just a tad tart. Medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation. Pretty good porter

Bottle (500 ml). Thanks to czar! Black with a huge mocha head and some lacing. Aroma of coffee/roasted malt, dark fruits and slight chocolate. Taste is slightly sweet with dark fruits, roasted malt/coffee, slight chocolate and a moderate acidic presence. Medium body. Dry. Good Porter with nice balance. A tad too much acidic presence for my liking though.

It pours dark brown with ruby highlights, almost opaque; the head is tan and marshmallow-like. The aroma has notes of: coffee, raisins, pumpernickel bread, and molasses. The taste is light bitter with a light sourness; there are notes of: charcoal, raisins, and pumpernickel bread. The palate is medium-light bodied, ultra heavy carbonation (huge bubbles), foamy mouth-feel, and a light finish. Overall, way too heavily carbonated to enjoy the flavour, it basically explodes into a foam in your mouth; makes me burpy...

Pours black with a huge moka head. Aroma of roasted malt mostly with a fresh component, spices? Taste is not sweet at all, dry like it should really be. Flavors are again roasted malt, grainy with again that fresh feeling mouthfeel. A really nice classic porter!
En av mine første øl som gjorde meg øl interessert. Fantastisk god fylde, ingen bitterhet, smak av sjokolade, lakris. Som fløte i munnen

Well, well... two Nøgne brews in a row (the other being their Underlig Jul). Huge, huge head (been a while since I saw one like this). Mocha coloured, creamy, thick lace with great retention. Dark brown colour is the beer with red highlights. Interesting nose with the roasted malts, molasses, dark fruits (prunes, dates), chocolate and hints of coffee and vanilla (even apples in the last pour). Holy smoke... that head wont go down ! The burnt malt is not as roasty in the taste, but nicely blended by the dark fruits, notes of coffee and the light hop grassiness. This is a nice strong porter that does not have the dark fruits overpowering, but is loaded with well-blended aromas and flavours. Yet, it goes down nicely.
0,5 samplke at hymir brewery. Pours a nice brownish 1 finger foam. Nose of some licorice and some hops. Taste is folowing trough with hoppy tones, some coffee and licorice.

Bottle from Voldby Koebmandsgaard. Pours very black with a small tan head. Aroma is roasted malt, chocolate and licorice. Taste is dark malts and chocolate with a hint of dark fruits. Finish is bittersweet with a note of chocolate. Very nice mouthfeel. Really good porter.

50cl bottle poured into a pint glass. Chunky and very dark brown. Aroma is subtle chocolate and cherries. Flavor is dominated by cherries with a strong backdrop of roasted malt and a subtle hops "how ya doin'". Ample carbonation. Excellent, flavorful beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On tap at tipplers tap. Slight chocolate/coffee smell. The coffee flovour stays through to a dry finish.
On tap at Zly casy. Pours black with decent brown head. Aroma is roasty, licorice, smokey. Flavor is malt, licorice, roasty, hint of hops.
Bottle. Pours a near black color with a moderate tan head. Nose is slightly bitter from English-style hops, Taste is a little roasty, and a tad bitter. OK, but not great.

UPDATED: MAY 22, 2015 Negro con reflejos rubí y espuma beis compacta. Aromas intensos, chocolate, regaliz, tostados y, más ligero, frutas confitadas. Cuerpo medio y sedoso, con inicio dulce, afrutado, sabor de chocolate y final de amargor equilibrado y tostado.

Pours a dark reddish-brown color with a tan frothy head. Plenty of chocolate and toasted malt on the nose. Milky chocolate taste, coffee, a little nuttiness and a moderate hop presence. Theres a bit of dark fruit on the front end too. Pretty full bodied for a porter, well balanced and delicious.

50 cL bottle from the LCBO, served in a snifter. Pours deep mahogany with a tall, dense tan head that remains and leaves lots of fine lace. On the nose, there are notes of roasted malts, molasses, chocolate, espresso and vanilla, along with and herby hoppy note. The flavour is dryish, with toasted malts, nuts, dark chocolate, espresso, dried fruit and a hint of anise; it is balanced with a slight earthy hoppiness. The finish is long, dry and chocolatey with a nice roasty, bitter quality. On the palate, it is medium-full in body, with a satiny texture and soft carbonation. Overall, this is a great porter. It is appropriately dry and roasty, but has a lot more complexity than most porters. Very well done, could be a great session brew! 2012-12-20

Bottle from the LCBO. Pours an opaque black with a WHOLE TON of foamy brown head. Smell is quite chocolaty with a bit of coffee and a bit of roastedness. Palate is medium bodied with a lot of carbonation. Taste is bitter at first, and then gets more bitter, but mixes with a roasted flavour softening the bitterness a bit. Interesting, and pretty good.
Bottle at konttori, tampere. Black color, light brown head. Smooth aroma with licorice. Balanced full taste, licorice, hops, coffee. Hoppy aftertaste.
Great Porter which is true to its category.. Aroma of coffee, chocolate and spices. Black in color, with a tan head. Great balance, and one of the best porters Ive tried.

500ml bottle. pours an extremely dark black with thick, brownish head. lacing until the end. aroma is of caramel, molasses, strong malts and coffee. taste is excellent. really full mouth feel, carbonation is just right with the taste of chocolate, bitterness of malts and coffee coming through.

500ml bottle. A very dark brown with reddish tones body, huge chocolaty head with excellent retention and tons of lacing. Aroma of roasted malt, black currant leaves, caramel, dark chocolate, a touch of leather. Taste is really nicely balanced: roasted malt, cacao, bitter herbal hops, dried berries. Well carbonated and dry. Late heat.
Bottle, pours a nice black, big head, a bit of over carbonated for me, it was almost too bubbly to taste, but it had a nice roast aroma and a good roasty taste, overall enjoyable

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2013 Black Metal and Black Beer: These are a few of my favourite Norwegian things. I have accused Nogne Ø of being artsy fartsy before, but how can I bear to taste this wonderful porter without bending my knees as if I was listening to a great satanic ode by a Black Metal band? First of all, the aroma. Black currant. Black also. A bit of a leathery (black olive) tone, but it is still sweet, ridiculously sweet, black currant. Dark brown as it pours and black on the glass, with a respectable tan head. This beer is a mouthful. How can they call it just a Porter? This is Baltic black gold! I know, I know, its North Sea, but ignore the geographic subtleties, as Baltic has more relevance in beer history.  Yes, chocolates, roasted malts, the berries, so many (Carpathian?) forest fruits, blah blah blah but it has this great petroleum touch to the tongue, and a high alcohol content that stirs the beer in your mouth, not too raw, but classy and perfectly aware of its surroundings. This beer is in control. Not as bleeding rare as Immortal, or rebellious as Emperor. Not overly sweetened as Enslaved, or too refined as Keep of Kalessin, but just the right balance between sheer blackness and the classy sweetness of the fruits. Yes, this is Dimmu Borgir. A sell out? Cmon, they just make good music as this is great beer. The porter doesnt go as far as playing with a symphony orchestra, but it stands in a podium of greatness, as DB does. If it wasnt for the bitterness of the price, Id have more of it, anytime.

Bottle. Dark opaque pour with creamy off white head. Aroma is meaty, roasted/toasted malts, chocolate, pretty classic porter aroma, slight fruitiness is present as well, peach/pear that might be from hops. Taste is fruity, lots of toasted malt, sweet and chocolatey. Palate is dry, light-medium bodied with good carb. Easy drinking and well made.

UPDATED: MAR 29, 2014 
50 cl bottle @ home. Rated on 19.09.2009
Aroma has nice roasted notes, coffee and licorice. Flavour is quite rich with licorice, coffee, some semi‐dark chocolate and hints of herbs. Also the Nøgne house flavour is strong on this one. One of the best porters Ive had.
8+4+8+4+16=4.0

50 cl bottle @ home. Batch #1074: brewed 19.11.2013, BBE 19.11.2016
Aroma has toffee, roastiness and Nøgne house aroma. Also hints of licorice. Flavour  has somewhat salty licorice, coffee, well roasted malt and hints of toffee. Foamy palate, a bit too high on CO2. Not as good as I remembered.

7+4+7+3+17 = 3.8

Bottle from Kris Wines. Dark black colour with a huge beige head, lots of initial carbonation. Roasty, currant and fruit cake, a fair alcoholic kick, some dark and dirty tar in the finish. Drinks very smoothly for all its full flavour. More of a stout than a porter, or maybe an imperial porter if such a thing exists, but either way high quality stuff.

Pours very dark brown with a small head that lingers a bit.  Aroma is more like a Belgian dark than a porter.  Lots of dark dried fruit in addition to coffee and roasted malt.  Taste is a very nice balance of dark fruit, coffee, chocolate and slightly burnt or smokey wood.  Very smooth finish and a fairly thick mouthfeel.  The dark fruit flavor really makes this porter stand out a bit.  Very nice.

Bouteille 500ml. De couleur noire et opaque. Nez de malt rôti, moyen de café, léger de chocolat noir avec des notes fruitées (mûres et prunes) ainsi que quelques traces de mélasse sucrée. Moyennement ronde en bouche avec un pétillement moyen ainsi quune texture légèrement crémeuse. Petites notes fruitées (mûres, traces de prunes) lors de lentrée en bouche rapidement suivi dun goût de malt rôti (faibles traces brûlées) vec des notes de chocolat noir et des traces de mélasse sucrée puis à mesure que lon approche de la finale, un moyen goût de café vient se rajouter progressivement et est accompagné de notes de houblon herbeux. Post-goût moyen-long et aux notes sèches, légèrement amer de rôti, moyen de café avec des notes de houblon herbeux.

Aged bottle of at least one year, unknown date. Pours brown black with beige fizz around the rim. The aroma is nutty chocolate among other grains. The flavor hits like a proper English porter. The grain runs medium bodied with a nice soft dark chocolate and medium roast. The yeast imparts nice dark fruit flavors and the brew is hearty enough to be slightly warming without being boozy. Light bittering leaves an earthy nutty roasted grain lingering with just enough sweet fruitiness to brighten it and make it a function as a complete and well done beer. Very little carbonation makes it go down very easy and makes me think the bottle is older than I expected. Very good for style.

Awesome beer. Pours pitch black with volatile brown, foamy head and leaves thick chunks of lacing. Pungent, robust aroma of coffee, nut and even a note of licorice. Medium consistency. Taste has light bitterness and sourness, though the beer is overall more nose heavy. Bottle.

Pours very dark brown almost black with no tint and a thick frothy, lasting, slightly fizzy, brown head. Nice full roasted malt smell, with dark chocolate, and a little bitter coco, smoke and some citrus hops. Medium thin body with very very soft carbonation. Tastes of roasted malt through with nice dark chocolate bitterness. A nice sweetness is balanced very well against the bitter smoky roast.

Kaatuu lasiin sysimustana ja keskikokoisella lähes ruskealla vaahdolla, jonka haihtuminen kestää hetken. Haju on todella vahvan paahteinen, hyvin salmiakkinen ja hennon suklainen. Pientä savuisuutta tuntuu myös nenässä. Maku on paahteinen, vahvan suklainen sekä lievän salmiakkinen ja savuinen. Suutuntuma on öljyinen ja keskitäyteläinen. Kokonaisuutena loistava porter, allekirjoittaneen mielestä paras tämän tyylin olut, mikä on tullut vastaan.

Cloudy chocolate black appearance. Impossibly sweet aroma and mocha flavour

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

(500mL bottle from LCBO) Poured opaque near-black with a pillowy tan head that receded slowly with little lace. Aromas were roasted malts, cocoa, rasins, slight smokiness. On the palate roast malts and a bit of chocolate mixed with sweetish plum and grape and a slight woody/nutty flavour, hint of salt or smoke. On the finish, quite dry, dusty and roasty with some slightly green hop bitterness. Medium mouthfeel for a porter, a little too fizzy and overcarbonated, no alcohol detected. This is a well-made, balanced porter, with the dark fruit giving it a more imperial stout-ish feel than most.

One of the best porters Ive had. Pours a motor oil black with a thin beige cap. The aroma is perfectly chocolatey, touch of roastiness, light vanilla, coffee, excellent. The flavour is a perfect reflection of all the aroma promises.   Finishes on a medium coffee note, and a bit of lingering licorice. Awesome.

Pours a dark, opaque brown, near black, with a finger of light brown head. Settles after several minutes with significant lacing. Aroma is roasted malt, dark malt, chocolate, Flavor is roasted malt up front, toasty, hints of coffee, fading quickly into mellow, smooth cocoa tones, hints of caramel. Mildly bitter finish that lingers briefly. Very rich. I find the flavor to be slightly dominated by the chocolate malts, but not in a bad way. Soft carbonation, medium-heavy body, and a slightly chewy texture. Rich, bold, An awesome beer.

500 ml bottle shared with friend @ friends new years party 
December 31,2012
Bottle from Vinmonopolet Rosenkrantzgate,Oslo
Served and tasted in a tulip glass
Dark black color.Aroma is coffee and malt
Medium to low carbonation
Nice creamy,sweet and burnt malt.A bit roasty and dry finish
One of my favorite porters

500ml bottle from an LCBO. Brown with a creamy biege head. Smoky and roasted malts, chocolate, some coffee. Smooth although a little thin on the palate, nice carbonation, bittersweet with some hops coming out on the dry finish.
bottle. Pours black with ruby hints, tan head. Aroma is chocolate, roasted malts, grapes. Thin mouthfeel, taste perfectly mirrors aroma, nicely balanced. Very nice.

0.5l bottle from the LBCO. Served in a tulip. Pours an opaque dark brown, with a fine beige head. Aroma: Malt, grapes, coffee, roasted nuts. Palate: Thick, creamy, slightly oily finish, fairly fizzy. Taste: Sweet, slight bitterness in the finish. Really nice porter. Lots of flavours going on here, and the mix of sweet and bitter is nice.

Bottle from LCBO.  Pours black and opaque, with thin tan lacing.  Aroma is roasty, with molasses and dark fruits.  The taste was not what I expect from a Porter, but I thought it was great!  Roasted malts, plums, cherries, and other fruits.  Dry roasty finish.  Despite the fruity flavours, Id still be willing to consider this a Porter over any other style.  Medium-bodied.  This was my favourite of the recent bunch of the 5 Nøgne beers the LCBO got in.

500 mL bottle. Pours opaque black with a thick brown head, lots of lacing to be had.  Aroma of roasted malt, caramel, chocolate, strong coffee and anise.  A touch of sweet with a bit of a bitter hop finish. Super smooth and creamy, full on the palate.  A textbook porter.

Caramel, dark fruit, rich chocolate. The chocolate aroma on this one is amazing.  Cant see through this one, completely dark. Foamy off-white head. Great chocolate, sweet, slightly rubbery taste that fades as the beer aerates. Medium bodied, bitter hop finish. Tastes kind of like an imperial stout. Medium bodied, fizzy. Lingering bitterness. Interesting take on a porter, good beer.

50cl bottle from Discount. Pours dark black with a chocolate milk head leaving nice lacing coating more than half the glass. Secret appears to be fairly continual carbonation; many fine bubbles throughout the duration of the glass. Aroma has caramel and coffee with nice roasty malts. Taste follows, along with some dark fruit hints. Quite smooth. Finishes sweet with bitterness back, about medium length. A nice solid porter.

500ml bottle 
7.0% ABV 
King/Spadina LCBO Outlet (Toronto, Ontario, Canada) 
December 7, 2012 
The beer pours a dark brown with black edges and a thin bubble light brown cap.  The aroma is roasted malt, cocao, and vanilla.  The mouthfeel is medium bodied with mild carbonation.  Flavour is on the sweet side with vanilla, molasses, and chocolate flavours overwhelming the roasted malt bitterness.

Over-priced 500mL bottle from the LCBO. Just below room-temp, this one pours an opaque dark brown with a large tan head. The aroma is really faint and understated but not in a good way. Lots of yeast on top of mediocre chocolate and roasted malts. Tiny hint of hops that is probably just my imagination. Flavour is a muddled mess of all of the above with a surprising amount of carbonation. I get absolutely no dark fruit at all. The finish has this weird, sort of astringent grassy character that is unpleasant. Very faint hop character in the background confirms that I wasnt imagining things with the aroma. This isnt totally without redeeming quality but it seems egregiously over-rated.

Bottle 50cl. Pours a very little dark head. Thick body, motor oil-ish. Aroma of licorice, sugar, bread. Taste has almonds, sugar and some kind of half-salty candy.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at Baxter Inn, Sydney. Pours a dark brown colour with a light brown head.  Nice lacing too. Aroma is a modest blend of  roasted malts, dark chocolate, light hops - hints of pine & grapefruit in there. Flavour upfront is moderate sweet with light bitterness, finishing with more of a harsher bitter end. Roasted malts and mocha flavours coming through. Soft carbonation.  Really nice

Im a porter pounder and I have been longing to see how Nogne dealt with this style, I wasnt disappointed. This is a porter that thinks its a stout in some ways. Rich dark opaque black in the glass...massive 3 finger cap like Mocha meringue. Pungent aroma of roast coffee and figs some cocoa and licorice notes. Thick body. Creamy satin mouth feel. Big roastiness, coffee, dark fruits...malty but never sweet, long decadent finish as bittering intensifies to a roasty-bitter astringence at the end. World class porter, I think I like this more than Meantime.
Sotto una bella coltre di neve, mi apro questa porter made in Norway. Aspetto da crack, naso bello tostato ma con sentori leggeri luppolosi. In bocca è pulita ed equilibrata, bene.

I cant believe I hadnt rated this before now as Ive seen it a million times and Im sure Ive had it - anyhoo - its damn tasty, so no skin off my back. Deep black pour with a creamy white head. The aroma is quite lovely - lots of bittersweet chocolate, cocoa and a fairly pronounced plumminess in back. Rich and chewy with a great balance of roast and cocoa. A moderate sort of bitterness that accents the roastiness. Lovely brew, really.

500 ml bottle from LCBO.  Pours a near black, opaque, dark brown with good-sized, lasting light brown head.  Aroma is very roasty malt, cocoa and dark fruit.  Flavour is also quite roasty with bitter dark chocolate, coffee and some dried dark fruit.  Silky carbonation.  Some dryness in finish.  Rather nice.
500ml bottle from the LCBO. dark brown, tan head. roasted malt, and hopsin the nose. layered, complex flavour, chocolate, coffee, roast malt, hops. hella drinkable. lovely stuff.

Aroma of sweet dried fruit, chocolate, and roasted malts. Pours a deep blackish brown with a minimal noneq lasting tan head and no lacing. The taste is roasted malts, chocolate, with hints of dried fruit. Medium-full body  with soft carbonation. Very smooth mouthfeel. Overall, an excellant porter.

50cl bottle. Black, but not opaque color. Good brown head, that fades to nothing. Cola nose. Little lace. Good roasty malts, light hops. Good, cheweir body, but still not heavy or sticky. Lighter carbonation, light bite, and sweet taste. Hint of chocolate, light dark fruitier hop. Its solid, but not really interesting or drinkable. Lacking something substantial to it, it is kind of oddly watery. Not easy to drink. OK, but not my kind of porter
Pours jet black with a short lived tan coloured head. Aroma is sweet, Fred fruits, coffee, cream, roasty. Taste has a nuttiness upfront. Not much bitterness. Dried red fruit. Mouthfeel is soft. Good
Bottle from the Vinmonopolet Oslo. Dark pour with a big frothy tan head. Weak malty aroma with a lovely smooth liquorice malty flavour. A lovely porter and very drinkable indeed.
500ml bottle from Appellation Wines. Very dark colour, not much head. Mild chocolate malt aroma. Mild chocolate coffee malt flavour. Smooth but watery, lacking flavour. OK but Overrated.

50cl. Bottle. Poors ruby black with nice cream head. Aroma is dark fruits, choco, coffee, sour, liquorice. Taste is Coffee bitter, with choco sweet and a nice fruity/sour finish. Mouth-feel creamy. I recommend!

UPDATED: OCT 16, 2012 from bottle; probably served colder than ideal, diminishing the richness of the flavor.  Still had excellent, roasted malt aroma and very good flavor with hints of smoke and peat.

Bottle. Pitch black with a light brown, compact head. Aroma is great: coffee, chocolate, malt and hints of cream. Flavor is... bitter coffee. What a disappointing description! Either way, mouthfeel is nice and creamy. But, the finish is a bit too dry and sharply bitter for my tastes.Overall, good beer, but the dryness/bitterness were somehow not exactly for me.

New Beer Distributors, NY 500ml ($8.50): Pours black with a large brown head. Aroma is chocolate, coffee, roasted malts, and some other good stuff. Taste is slightly sweet. Mildly bitter chocolate present. Bitterness present towards the middle and then mellows out into a nice smoky, roasty aftertaste. Body is exactly as it should be. Balance is also perfect. I am like.

Bottle from Vinmonopolet, Norway. Pours pitch black, with a decent light brownish head.  Aroma of coffee and dark chocolate especially. Great mouthfeel, very thick and smooth.  Taste is again coffee and roasted malts, and leaves off with an enjoyable bitter aftertaste.  Overall a very good porter!

Rating #762, bottle from Bartoff  

A pitchblack beer with red hue, and only a small head. Aroma is tarish malts, pitch and chocolate. Flavor has loads of chocolate, roasted malts, a bit alcohol, a bit smoke, maybe a bit cheese-like flavours, and a pretty bitter finish. Furthermore, there is a secondary aftertaste of some spices, maybe hemp or thyme. Medium thick and creamy aftertaste.  Good and heavy.

Tap at Trion. Dark fruit, roasty malt, coffee, and light alcohol (as it warmed) aroma. Black brown with a large tan head, thick creamy lacing. Earthy/peaty smoky malt and coffee flavor. Medium creamy body.
Bottle from Burger Bar at Mandalay Bay. Black with a good brown head and thick lacing. Rich, silky porter. Lots of chocolate and coffee with some fruit and a really nice bitterness. Nice.

From a 500ml bottle, pours black with a tan head, light comes through the edges, making them a very deep red. Smell is not too strong, mostly roasted malts coming through. Taste is dominated by roasted malt and some coffee, with slight chocolate notes. Has a roasty finish, smooth mouth feel, medium bodied. A good beer, if a little overpriced. Too expensive for me to consider having again, a little disappointed after trying their excellent Imperial Brown Ale.

50 cl bottle @ home. Pours black with some sediment and a tan head that leaves some lacing. Aroma is roasted malt, chocolate, coffee,sweet liquorice, and a little vanilla. Flavour is dominated by roasted malt and some bitter coffee.

50cl. Bottle. 
Poors ruby black with nice cream head. 
Aroma is dark fruits, choco, coffee, sour, liquorice. 
Taste is Coffee bitter, with choco sweet and a nice fruity/sour finish. 
Mouth-feel creamy. 
Amazing beer!
Pours black with a thin latte coloured head. Strong aroma with malts and some caramel and chocolate. Soft and creamy mouthfeel. Sweet taste with slight bitterness. Very pleasant tasting experience.

500ml bottle. Clear darkest brown with huge, firm, frothy to creamy, moderately lacing, beige head. Roasty dark malty aroma with an herbal touch, liquorice, dark, blue berries. Taste is initially roasty dark malty, minimally smokey, later minimally sweet fruity notes of dark berries shine through; dry to bitter overtones of fruit parings and a touch of leather.
Got in a bottle, Very Dark Beer with hints of roasted coffee and chocolate with also a fruity aftertaste that makes it a very good beer

Drank at home (Dec 11) and pours very dark brown to black, but not a full black, whilst an average head remained throughout drinking dying off towards the end.

Smooth feel on the mouth when imbibing with a medium sweet, toffee, roasted, only a slight hint of coffee taste

Very pleasant aftertaste, slightly malty and slightly less sweet than the initial taste.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text:
Aroma: Malty with nice roasted/burned notes. Also hints of coffee.
Appearance: Black velvet colour, with slight brown head.
Taste and palate: Heavy body, bitter from the roasted malt and sweet from the unfermentable sugars. Hops very faint in the back of the dark malt, with a slight earthy touch. 
The finish is long and roasted
It is a very good porter, but the price is too high, as similar good porters can be found at lower cost. It is still very good!
Tap at the Ginger Man. Tastes like coffee, chocolate, and a hint of ddried fruit and alcohol, with an excellent silky-smooth texture going down. Great beer.

500ml bottle in an English pint.  Pours very dark brown with a lacy, tan head.  Aroma of chocolate and roasted malts, a little dark fruits, and floral hops.  Flavor the same.  Thicker texture.  A good beer.

On bottle from Vinmonopolet Økern.
Black color , some foam.
Aromas of licorice , coffee & vanilla.
Full body & complexity.
Very enjoyable
Black body, light brown head. Roasted malty aroma with coffee and chocolate. Medium, well carbonated palate. Bittersweet flavour with black chocolate and licorice. An excellent porter.
Id had this sitting in the fridge for a long time and finally got to it. A great porter, dark smooth and easily drunk. I was disappointed when the bottle was empty. Great winter beer
una gran bella porter che si sa distinguere dalle molte altre in circolazione. carattere deciso e note di caffè emergono principalmente.

UPDATED: OCT 31, 2012 Love this one. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, spices, fruits and some licorice. The thing with this porter is that the ingredients are so fantasticly well balanced! The dept and mouthfeel is also amazing. My favorite porter, that went really good with the browncheese-parfait I combined it with. One of the best pairings Ive tried.
500ml bottle. Black with small dark off-white head. Aroma has licorice, chocolate and cocoa. The flavor is sweet with notes of chocolate and coffee. Long delicious aftertaste.

50cl bottle at a norwegian evening.
Decent tan head.  Deep dark pour.  A very nice porter.

Bottle. Pours dark brown, with a thick, but quickly receding head. Aroma is tar and liquorice, with notes of coffee. Flavour is heavy, roasted malt, with coffee, liquorice and a nice burned bitter balance. Lots of carbonation. Nice bitter finish, that is disappointingly short lasting.

18th November 2009Opaque black beer. Palate slightly crisp. Even dark malt. not bitter or roasty but tangy and with some minerals. Finishes semi dry with a touch of hop fruit and bitterness. Inoffensive.

A - pours opaque coffee black with high fluffy head that dissipates quickly to a thin layer leaving sticky lacing. S - very strong dark aromas, much like a barrel stout. Coffee, dark candied molasses, toffee, vanilla on the nose. Notes of dark dried fruit, dry earthy tones and campfire smoke. M - interesting lighter than I expect with a tang up front. Weaker intro to a nice rounded ending. Lingering malty sweet end. T - Coffee grounds and burned malts up front. Slowly changes to a toffee, molasses sweet end with a subtle hint of hops. O - very good porter. Tastes came in weaker than the nose. But good overall. 7

Refrigerated 0.5 L bottle poured into a shaker.  Pours black with small dark brown highlight and medium size fluffy head.  Thick small bubble lacing, creamy body, medium carbonation, smooth texture, and sweet roasted malt aroma.  Taste is roasted malt, some chocolate, some lactose, little salty, and light bitter hop finish.  Good porter, alcohol is pretty well covered, may be closer to a baltic porter in taste.

500ml bottle. Near black with a creme head and spotty lacing. Lots of roasted chocolate malt in the taste and aroma, with some fleeting berry fruitiness and a helping of vanilla ice cream. Just above medium bodied, with a surprising amount of kick from the carbonation. Good beer, but it didnt live up to my high expectations.

Bottle bought at Vinmonopolet Valkendorfgate. Batch 735.
Thick, black pour into the glass, with solid, frothy tan head. The head slowly settles to a thinner pillow on the beer, leaving some nice lacings on the glass.
The aroma is discreet at first, but with gradually intensified characteristics of chocolate, coffee, nuts and nice, roasty toast from the malt. Possibly a hint of herbs coming through from the hops. The aroma evolves as the beer warms up in my glass.
The taste is a light sweetness that fades over into a medium smooth bitterness. The roasty aromas are really present when swallowing as well, leaving a long smooth finish.
One of my favorite porters, for sure!

Originally reviewed: 2/10/09. Pours a viscous deep black. Comes out thick and syrupy. Decent tan head on top. Doesnt carry the best retention, but leaves mild webbing on the glass edge. Smells of cherries, plums, roasted scents, some coffee, and a little alcohol. 

This beer is fairly smooth which makes it an easy drinker. Though it came in a larger bottle, I didnt find it difficult to finish the bottle. Nice roasted characteristics come through in the flavor, but I wasnt overly impressed with the flavor on this one. There was a tangy sour-like note in the finish that was a little disappointing. Could taste some of the dark fruits in there as well, but overall, just fell a little short of my "expectations..." Whatever those are. Not that bad, but not the greatest. Still, I recommend you try it for yourself.

Much more rough and fizzy than a normal stout beer. You feel soon the Alcohol go up to your head! Strong body and sexy Foam. 
Drink this if you want something "stout" but with a more AGRICULTURAL (cit.)Taste!

Flaske 0,5l fra Vinmonopolet Byhaven. Batch 735.
Nydelig svart farge med en fin head.
Flott fylde, balansert smak. Høy alkoholprosent til å være en porter, men det kler dette ølet.

Bottom line: Pure class.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Belting full bodied porter. Lively with plenty of burnt malt, liquorice, quite dry on the palate. Lasting flavour and hint of sweetness. Surprisingly crisp but beautiful warming nature.

Bottle at Parkteateret, Oslo. Pours pretty black with a reddish hue and a beige head. Aroma of roasted malt with some chocolate and coffee. Quite nice. Not much sweetness, but some alcohol is noticable. Slightly bitter finish.

BLACK colour with a beige head. Moderate sweet and a some roasted malt aroma. Massive and also a moderate flavour. Lots of raosted malt. Chocolate, caramel and espresso flavour.I had a beer tasting with 20 different Nøgne Ø bottles lately. Even the girls rated this one as the best. A great allrounder for everyone. Heavy but not overkill.[Bottle from Vinmonopolet in Halden, Norway]
Rich and malty porter, quite sweet with caramel, sugar and alcohol all notable. A hint of fruit as well. Really satisfying beer. (50th country rated).

Interesting beer. Aroma is roasted malts, but quite mild. Taste is quite refined , no great hit of alcohol and very light smoke. Perhaps most surprising is the lack of sweetness for a porter. Very drinkable if a little too refined! :)
Keg at Euston Tap, London. A black coloured pour with a healthy beige head on top. Roasty, malty aroma. Tastes malty, roasty, chocolate, caramel, coffee, bitter. Pretty good porter.

Bottle from Chester Beer & Wine. Deep dark brown pour with a generous tan head. Coffee, roasted malt and dark chocolate all present in the nose with some vague hoppage. Smooth, soft and creamy with a great body and gentle carbonation. Rich flavour with similar traits to the nose alongside some notes of fruit. Some booze and bitterness developed towards the finish. Really enjoyable porter. Laaverly stuff.

[4187-20111210] Bottle. Fresh mild roasted hops. Black body with a long-lasting creamy light brown head. Floral roasted malt flavour has a bit of a sweet candy aftertaste. Full body. Delicious and quite drinkable. (7/4/8/4/17) 4.0
(w/ jerc, tuqueboy, others)

Nera, densa, impenetrabile, con schiuma color cappuccino. Aroma 
  delicatissimo di malti tostati, cioccolato, caffè e luppolo ma poco in 
 evidenza. In bocca è dolciastra, con note di tostato, caramello, cioccolato, caffè e finale amarognolo. Vellutata, morbida, assolutamente bevibile,Tra le migliori porter mai bevute. Al palato è stratosferica. Una meraviglia.

Dark brown with thick tan froth. Nose is chocolate, molasses, grape and grain. Milky medium body with a metallic tang. Taste is espresso, chocolate, black walnut and grapefruit peel. Good but not so exciting.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: FEB 19, 2012 Tap @ St. Urho´s Helsinki. Poured black color with a beige/brown head. Nice lacing. Aroma is liquirice and roasted malt mostly. Flavor similar, lots of liquirice, along with hops and roasted malt. Chocolate towards finish. Great porter.Very smooth, slightly oily moutfeel.

Bottle, 50cl, bottled 2010.
Pours black with a generous brown head.
Smells subtle, of chocolate and heavy malts.
Tastes creamy, with semi-sweet chocolate and a medium bitterness.
Creamy texture. Soft carbonation. Finishes dry, with a long bitterness.
A fantastic porter.

Bottle sent my way by BlackIPA! 

The beer pours a very dark brown with a big slightly loose head that leaves lots of lacing on the glass. 

The aroma is lovely with a roasty coffee on chocolate aroma, mocha like yet not particularly sweet smelling. There is a light character of plum in the aroma and some raw malt in there as well. 

The flavor is roasty with some popsicle stick woodiness up front that thankfully fades. The beer is lightly smoky and doesnt offer a whole elot in the way of sweetness. The bitterness is very satisfying and while the beer is very bitter this aspect never becomes unpleasant or overbearing. Most beers this rich are much sweeter than this one is, like usual with Nøgne Elegant and excellent.
Despite the 7 abv. it is very easy to drink a good porter would say! Nogne very good brewery! nice beers!

24/06/2011 Brasserie 4:20 (tap). Bevuta al Nøgne Ø Beer Festival. Nera, densa, impenetrabile, bel cappello di schiuma color cappuccino. Aroma delicatissimo di malti tostati, cioccolato, caffè, luppolo poco in evidenza. In bocca è dolciastra, con note di tostato, caramello, cioccolato, caffè e una punta di lattosio, finale amarognolo. Vellutata, morbida, assolutamente bevibile, corpo medio, carbonazione soft. Tra le migliori porter mai bevute. Al palato è stratosferica, vellutata e preziosissima. Una meraviglia.

pours coal black, huge light brown fluffy head. great retention. on the nose, milk thistle, sweet fruity esters, smoked malts, roasted coffee beans, chocolate. once on the palate, cola, coffee bitterness, pepper, vanilla, hazelnut. lots of carbonation and lighter bodied. smooth and developed as it warmed. Quite good.

2008 Vintage 50 cl. bottle @ home  batch 377 / bottled on 18.08.2008  purchased @ Alvinne  dark black with a creamy mocha head  smells like molasses, coffee, berries, dark fruits & slight spices - slightly emptied out in the front due to the aging leading into grounded / grainy coffee mixed with a touch of red wine (main flavours), molasses, slight chocolate & hint of cold, stale coffee, hint berries, sweet mixed with a touch ashy bitterness, definitely vintage, touch too long aged, slightly vintage, creamy body, carbonation touch softened

Draught @ The Rover. Pours dark reddish brown, almost black, with a creamy mocha head that clings to the glass while dissipating. Smell is sweet with roasted malts, sweetened coffee, liquorice toffee and hints of alcohol. Taste is sweet with roasted malts, coffee, liquorice, vanilla, milk chocolate, wood and raisins. Finish is slightly sweet and slightly bitter with coffee and liquorice.

Black, with a huge brown head. Really big. Powerful like a gorilla. Smells milky, chocolatey, and some vanilla, too. Hints of coffee. Smooth, rich palate. More milky chocolate, coffee and vanilla in the aroma. Very tasty stuff.
A fine refinement of the typical porter profile. Its got all the malty, coffee and chocolate favours youd expect.
On tap. Black with thin head. Heavy malts. Licorice and wheatabix. A little oily. Alcohol taste. Nice enough, but nothing special.

Bottle/500ml - Pours a very dark black/brown in color with a small tan head.  Some nice lacing on the glass.  Aroma is coffee and chocolate... and a bit of smoke.  Flavor is slightly bitter... from the hops and the very dark malts (black patent). Nice chocolate in the finish...  I really like this!

500ml bottle. This looks good in the glass with a deep head of light chocolate brown foam that settles to an even film. Colour of the beer is tar black with strong roasted coffee bean and dark chocolate aromas that set you up for what is to follow. Flavour is every bit as good as the aroma and while the beer is thin in the mouth there is a lasting effect on the palate. Roasted malt, coffee and chocolate stand out in the flavour and there is a creamy fullness in the mouth that is satisfying.
Dark brown with thon mocha head. Fairly subdued slight beechwood smoke on nose. Initially sweet with chocolate and dried fruit. Thick body and a slightly astringent/alcoholic finish.

nice aroma - complex roasted; even burnt stuffs; chocolate.  nice brown pour with frothy large tan head - taste was disappointing though.  palate should be thicker;  heavy on the charred taste, some chocolate but the char is too strong and there is something (sour?) that just doesnt work...

16.9 oz bottle.  Dark brown with thick tan froth.  Nose is chocolate, molasses, grape and grain.  Milky medium body with a metallic tang.  Taste is espresso, chocolate, black walnut and grapefruit peel.  Good but not so exciting.
Black with light brown head - sweet malt aroma of caramel and some coffee - good malt body with some sweetness in the back - very good
Bottle. Pours really dark brown with a dark tan head. Aroma is chocolate and roast. Flavour of chocolate, roast, rich fruit with a finish that is sweet at first but ends fairly bitter. Excellent.

Really dark beer with a nice tan head that stays. Chocolate aroma, some sourness, clay, and roasted smell. Some coffee aroma. Some sourness in taste with a sweet finish. And also some odd background taste that I cant really tell what it is.

Bottle from Pivoteka Zly casy, Prague. Almost black color with huge beige head. Aroma of coffee, dried plums, caramel, honey. Taste, strongly in coffee, dark chocolate, wood, bitter hops, hints of smoke. Dry finish. Nice.

Black/brown pour with tan head and lace.  Aroma is chocolate,  Flavor is chocolate, roasted malt, and a stiff coffee like bitter. Nice carbonation but a bit thin, foamy, and watery. A finishing taste of almost oats, just not sure.

Bottle shared with ClubGonzo. Deep dark brown to black colour, cloudy. Big beige lasting head. Aromas of sweet chocolate malt. Fantastic taste with chocolate, coffee and more malt sweetness with dried fruit. Nice medium bitterness. Fullbodied with a oily mouthfeel. An excelent porter which only gets better for each time i drink it.
Bottle pours dark brown with a small but dense tan head. Rich roasted malt aroma and flavor with molasses, caramel, chocolate and coffee notes but less sweet that it sounds.
Very dark, almost black colour, head is light brown. Roasted malts in aroma and taste, coffee as well. (Bottle)

Bottle pours near black with a thick, creamy tan head. Aromas of roasted malt, coffee, and chocolate. Taste is roasted malts and chocolate. Body is full with thick lasting head. Finish is medium and sweet. Overall, an excellent porter.

Appearance: pitch black, small brown head. Aroma: spicy, chocolate, malt, cloves, coffee. Flavour: chocolate, malt, cranberry, spices, a medium body, long malty finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

500ml bottle pours a dark brown color with some reddish hues when held to a bright light source and has a finger and a half of beige head with good retention and some nice lacing on the glass.  Aroma is roasted malts and a trace of hops.  Taste is roasted malt bitterness with enough malty sweetness to balance things out and a pleasing hop bitterness to round things out.  This is a really enjoyable porter.

500 ml bottle, no bottle date.  Pours very dark brown color with a small 1 finger dense tan head with good retention that reduces to a thin cap that lasts.  A fair amount of lacing clings to the glass as well.  Aromas of big caramel, roasted malt, bread, molasses, chocolate, and some dark fruits.  Nice aromas with good strength and balance.  Taste of caramel, chocolate, roasted malt, toasted bread, light coffee, molasses, and a bit of dark fruits.  Light amount of spicy bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of chocolate, caramel, toast, and molasses on the finish.  Medium carbonation and body; with a nice and creamy mouthfeel that drinks very easily.  No alcohol noticed other than a slight warming on the finish.  Overall this is a very nice and well rounded porter with robust flavor and good balance.
Riktigt mörk med litet moccafärgat skum. Inte en favoritporter. Inslag av koldoft tillsammans med de rostade tonerna.

Bottle from Alexander Wines, Coventry, drank at The Penguin with Octo and Dirtman; "Violets growing out of a cowpat aroma, rust. Pitch with a thick nicotine head. Milky, rusty...nice blackcurrant undercurrents. Coal-dusted. Really good coal-dusted liquorice notes. Light sulphur." Thatll do.

500 mL bottle from Grape & Gourmet.  Dark brown, nearly black, pour with a creamy tan head.  The aroma is of rich coffee and chocolate and is slightly boozy.  Wonderful flavor of dark chocolate, smoke, and roasted coffee with hints of dark fruit.  While there is no burn from the alcohol, as I thought might be the case judging from the aroma, there is an extra level of warmth and a bit more body than many porters.  Without question this is one of the finest porters I have ever tried.

[keg at Bacchus, Newcastle] Deep, rich brown pour from the keg, good head. Roasty aromas, albeit cold from the keg. Once the beer warms, the malt component comes out even more. Plenty of alcohol in there, finish is long and roasty, some stone fruit in evidence. Love the aftertaste, which is heavy on the mocha flavours [12112011]

50 cl bottle @ Olutravintola Konttori, Tampere. Batch #406. Brewed on 21.01.2009, BBE 21.01.2014.
Originally rated on 20090214. (8+4+9+4+16)
Pours dark ruby re colour with medium head. Aroma of lots of berries like bilberry, mild roasted malts, light chocolate, dry mocha-like coffee and light caramel. Flavour of bilberries, toasted malts, mild coffee, chocolate and mild toffee at the end. Smooth palate with a surpisingly berry-like flavour. Balanced and very drinkable brew.
5326
Bottle. Aroma has plumes, maybe yhe age (2009). Smells like a barley wine. Taste roasted malts, some licorice. Not Bad.
Nice porter.  Malts are specific to a lot of scandanavian dark beers that I enjoy.  A nutty spicy flavor matches well with the roasty flavors of the porter.  Quite good.

Pours black with thin charcoal head.  Aroma is dark chocolate, smokeyness, caramel and coffee.  Taste is sweet with a coffee bitter finish.  Smooth and oily mouthfeel.  Overall this is a great porter.

500 ml bottle, this is great.
Very rich and sweet, big thick body, bitter flavor but not in the aftertaste.

oured from the tap into a pint glass

The color is a dark black with some maroon highlights and about two fingers of foamy brownish head and some nice lacing left on the glass.

The smell is roasty with a little dry malt aroma. There is some dark chocolate aroma in the nose that has a coffee roast like aroma too.

The taste is roasted malt and is filled with a nice dry chocolate flavor that sets back a bit to hang with a coffee flavor that mixes with some nice toast burnt flavor.

The feel of this beer is complex but smooth as it goes down with ease and has a silky aftertaste that is more enjoyable then a lot of Porters I have had. This one is one of the better ones.
From bottle. Pours black with thin tan head. Big roast malt aroma, slightly metallic. Taste has chocolate, coffee, vanilla, touch of licorice. Very good.
Bottle. Pours a beautiful black with off whit head. Not a punchy nose but wonderful roasted flavour and a thickness which is a joy to the palate. Delicious.
Bottle pours black with a thick light brown head. Scent is roasted malts and chocolate. Taste is dark chocolate, coffee and roasted malt. Very nice!

500ml bottle, beersofeurope.com Medium smoky aroma, the flavour and palate is beautifully smooth and very full-flavoured. Chocolate, dried fruit, tobacco, coffee and roast all easily discernible, slips down way too easily. There is some alcohol heat, but its very much in balance. Dry finish, some medicinal blackcurrant aroma late on. A great porter.

Opaque black coffe color with small head and no lacing.  Taste is of bitter roasted caramel malt and semi-sweet chocolate.  Goes well with dark chocolate or with havarti cheese and carrs wafers.  Best as a late evening sipping beer, one that tastes big, yet doesnt overfill.
No head and a blank aroma are a bad start for this dark ale. Flavor of chocolate and roast are not balanced and leave a dry finish. Not my favorite example of a brown porter.

AROMA: coffee, nuts, resin, liquorish
APPEARANCE: black, brown foam, disappears quickly
TASTE: light sweetness, lightly bitter
PALATE: full body, oily feel, almost gritty, lively, hint of bitter finish
OVERALL: this is a really nicely balanced beer, somewhere between a porter and a dubbel. Bit alcoholic for 7% at the start but quickly the warm and dark fruity tones take over.
Pours almost black. Tan head, which disappears quickly. Almost no nose. Malty aroma, as well as chocolate. Some smoke. Good.
Pours murky black with a small beige head. Aroma is coffee, dark fruit, malt. Taste is coffee, licorice, chocolate milk, dates. Good body, velvety mouthfeel, coffee finish with a hint of bitterness.
Black of color with a brown head. An aroma of roasted malt, liqurice, coffee and smoke. A flavor of roasted malt, coffee, bitter and weak smoke.

Poured from a bottle into a snifter.  Pours a dark brown, almost black, color with a tan head that fades quickly.  Plenty roasty in the nose.  Tastes pretty strongly of roasted malts as well, nice subtle hop kick at the end, goes down nice and easy.  A little watery feeling.  Overall a decent brew, but doesnt match up with a top tier porter like Black Butte or Edmund Fitzgerald.

Almost opaque black with a medium head......nice malty aroma,   Tasted lots of roasted malt, molasses, possibly a little bourbon, a little fruitiness with a slight hoppy finish.  A little thinner than I expected but very tasty
Pours a dark black with a tan head.  Smell was similar to leather.  Had a good malty flavor.  Drank this out of a trappist glass

50cl bottle. Pours opaque black with a hint of a plummy colour somewhere around the bottom of the glass. Theres a niced beige head which hangs around for a little while. The nose has milk chocolate and dried fruits, maybe plump raisins. The taste has more of the chocolate but this time its dark chocolate and there is a dry amokwy creaminess through to the finish. The palate is big in structure with a nice creamy texture and the finish falls away reasonably well in a fairly elegant style. Overall, an interesting beer, I think its got the usual Porter characteristics on the nose but the taste is somewhere between that and a dry stout style. Good beer.
UPDATED: NOV 12, 2012 Pura goduria. Una porter con i controcazzi, che ti accarezza il palato ma con tanta sostanza dentro. I nordeuropei sono i migliori.

Bottle.  Midnight black with an initially nice tan head, but it settles quite quickly.  The aroma is of exceptionally bitter cocoa.  The bitter drinks with a chalky impression, but I believe it a mind trick as a product of the dry bitterness of pure dark chocolate.  Fairly light body.  (#4239, 9/8/2011)
Lovely black beer with a thin cream head.  Aroma of liquorice and malts, almost like a whisky.  Flavour is malts,liquorice and coffee.

Drought @ Mikkeller bar. Black pour, thin light brown head. Aroma is spicy roasted malts, licorice, some leather and coffee. Flavor is slightly bitter, roasted, some sweet licorice. Nicely balanced, subtle porter. Good beer.

Tap @ Håndverkerstuene, Oslo. Pours pitch black with a small brown head leaving lace. Aroma is roasted malty, dry, coffee, licorice and hoppy. Flavor is lean and balanced malty, roasted, coffee, licorice, bitter, slightly fruity and a bit sweet. Finishes with a good bitter tart aftertaste. Very drinkable, not too heavy.

On keg at Bacchus, Newcastle. A black beer with a thick, light tan head. Aroma primarily of chocolate with dark malts and coffee. Coffee flavour with roasted barley, burnt toast and caramel. Medium carbonation with a light CO2 prickle and a foamy mouth-feel. A nice long bitter, roasty burnt toast finish.

Bottle. Very dark brown, reddish highlights. Good creamy beige head fades to a thin film. Coffee, dark chocolate, some dark fruit on the nose. Palate is roasty and woody, with a beautiful chocolatey note and a dark cocoa finish. Beautiful balanced porter.

UPDATED: SEP 22, 2011 
Draught at Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen. July 2011.

Black with a tint of red, White head. Aroma is coffee, chocolate and dried wood. Medium to full body. Tastes of chocolate and wood with some roasted notes. Considerably light and dry for being a porter, something fussy about it. I wonder if the bottle is the same, luckily for me Im sitting on one...

0.5l bottle. Finally its time to rate this "one of my many favorite beers" from Nøgne Ø. It pours a dark dark brown body with a big creamy and lasting mild khaki head. Its aroma has lots of beautiful grassy hops, rich dark burned malts, dark licorice, nice sweet chocolate, some strong dark caramel and hints of dark fruits. Really nice aroma indeed. It has a nice oily to chewy mouthfeeling, average to soft carbonation and its somewhat full-bodied. Tastes quite hopy for a dark porter. Light sweet with good chocolate flavors combined with dark roasted malts and licorice. The finish is fantastic warming and tingling. Ends in a lasting chocolate and licorice aftertaste. A really nice beer, and absolutely one of my favorite porters!

Inky black body with a thin beige head of tiny bubbles. Aromas of chocolate, coffee and some caramel.  Chocolatey flavor along with some coffee and subtle hints of smoke and a bitter finish. A little thin in the mouth but very lively.

13-AUG-2011, bottle @home, from "Fish & Beer".
Black with huge very, very small bubbles, light brown head.  Very smooth head, very wipped cream-like. That is a 5.
Roasted with chocolate and coffee - almost cafe latte or sweet espresso.
Somewhat burned but that sweet chocolate taste and texture balances that.
Long bitter finish with a berry note.
The smoothest of porter. Fantastic.

Very nice, well-balanced porter. Pours with a black color, culminating in a medium-sized and resilient dark tan head. The lacing is tight and sticky and clings to the glass long after this tasty treat is gone. The nose is distinctly roasted malts: charcoal, coffee and chocolate. The mouth feel is creamy and the flavor profile is top quality: roasted malts, some chocolate and hints of coffee. Another fine product from Nøgne Ø.

Sweeeeet.
(This beer rating was imported from FB and unfortunately lacks any further comments.)

Oh my! This half litre of beer is like nothing else! Tasty and dark. Perfect beer! Highly recommended!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Dark. Coffee and chocolate bitterness and burnt caramel. Outstanding. Smells like... nothing, though.

Bottle @ home. Deep black appearance with a dark brown head. Roasty chocolate, black licorice, anise, char nose. Strong charred, tar, asphalt, anise, burnt chocolate flavor. Charred, burnt, chocolate, licorice aftertaste. I cant explain why but I really dislike Scandinavian Porters and Stouts.

Draft @ mikkeller bar. Aroma is roasted malt, coffee, smoke, tobacco, molasses and a whole lot more. Wow.
Flavour is smoky coffee, roasted malt, molasses and more. Lighter then expected in body, but lingering on for ages. Lovely beer.
Bottle @ Pannuhuone, Kuopio. Originally rated on 8.5.2010. Great and well balanced porter with notes of chocolate and roasted malts.

500ml bottle picked up at Khourys in LV 
Appearance: Pours dark brown with a big beige head and lots of lacing 
Aroma: Roasted malts, dark fruit, smokey and dry chocolate 
Taste: Roasted malts, ashy and coffee 
Nice and roasty
Bottle 50 cl. Black with a nice foamy light brown head. Great roasted malty and chocolate with sence of dark fruits. The taste is still roasted malty with a dark chocolate ending. Nice!

Pours black. Silky off white foaming head which dissipates quickly. Nose is syrupy dark chocolate. Taste is smooth chocolate and quite a bit of roasted bitterness on the finish. Bit of fruitiness in the bitterness which gives way to some woody notes on the finish.

Tall 500 ml bottle thanks to Nate. Pours a pure black color with a medium brown head. A smooth nose of chocolates, some metal and light hops. The flavor is full of slightly sour dark fruits, dry chocolate, roasted malts, metallic roasted flavors, a light lingering bitter fruit and hops. Nice. A very smooth and enjoyable brew.
Pours black with a dark brown head. Citrus with black coffee and hints of chocolate.

Draught at Rover 2011-06-10 Göteborg
AR: caramel fudge + roasted malt, odd but very nice combo, the aroma is a bit sugary sticky (which is possitive - in this case)
AP: amber with reddish tone, frothy beige head
F: roasted malt, butter fudge, thinn & dry finish

On draft at Henrik Øl og Vinstove, Bergen.  Pours dark brown with light tan head.  Aroma is chocolate, malt and light coffee.  Flavour is mellow and matches aroma with a good bitterness. (Rated offline on 2011/04/13)

Bottle, 50cl. Pours a clear and dark brown beer with a large offwhite head. The aroma is malt, roasted and notes of licorice. The flavor is close to the nose with additional alcohol. The palate is dry with roasted notes and some alcoholwarmth. Overall a good beer.
Pours dark brown with a beige head. Aroma is roasted malt, coffee and light chocolate. Flavour is roasted malt, chocolate and light alcohol. Dry aftertaste.
Black colur with a mediumsized head. Aroma of coffee and oak undertones. Flavor is roasted with coffee and strongly bitter. Pretty boring porter overall. Watery finish.

Bottle; Pour is dark brown, with a modest khaki head in this snifter. Chocolate, caramel, licorice on the nose; this is a nice porter - the english notes are obvious, but you can sense the other elements in this brew as well. I always enjoy when the brewers put up their ingredients list. Chocolate, leather, caramel, mild bitter floral hop profile, and a general english feel, really. Nice.

Pours a completely black colour with a light brown head. Chocolate hints, dry fruits, plums and some caramel notes in the aroma. Light sweetness and medium bitterness in the taste. Round malty flavour, dark chocolate notes and some coffee too. Full body, creamy feel, soft carbonation and a long medium bitter and chocolatie-like finish. Another quality product from Nøgne Ø. Nice.

Herb-schokoladiger Antrunk, dessen Malz aber schnell nachlässt. Im Mittelteil eher getreidig, trocken, die Intensität ist gering, das Bier langweilig. Im Abgang zusätzlich ein wenig säuerlich. Naja... 12/8/7/7/10/7

Bouteille de 500ml. Batch 502. Ce Porter est brun très foncé presque noir. La structure mousseuse est important, épaisse et de couleur brune. Le nez est fruité avec des arômes de fruits secs et des notes rôties. La bouche a une drôle de texture à la fois ronde à lattaque et mince à la finale. Elle est sèche. Les goûts sont de fruits secs, de chocolat et de café.

Pours tawny brown with fluffy khaki head.  Aroma is of licorice, leather, coffee, green hops.  On the palate it is full bodied and rich, tastes like chocolate and coffee, the hops only come through in the lasting bitterness. This beer has the full flavor of malted barley that only European beers seem to express in its entirety.  Its like a meal.  This is a screamingly good porter--although at $8 per bottle, I would much rather have a 6 pack of Edmund Fitzgerald.  A rare and exotic treat from Norway!

On tap at Biero. Masterpiece. Aromas of chocolate, vanilla, and caramel. Taste is sweet, with light bitterness, and very long length. Palate is creamy, and full bodied. Black, with a frothy white head.
Big roasty nose, coffee, soy, and some licorice. Quite hoppy, pine notes, and a very dry bitter espresso finish. A little too hoppy for a porter in my opinion, but its pretty good.

UPDATED: JUL 16, 2011 Original rating, 2011-04-20, 7-4-7-5-14=3.7
A newly poured porter must be one of the most beautiful sights on this planet, and the Nøgne Ø porter is no exception: a black body with a coca cola brownness at the edges, crowned by a large, dense light brown head. The head isnt as persistent as I would have wished for, it reduces to a thin layer with additional build-up at along the rim in a few minutes. The remains of the head nevertheless laces the glass until the brew is gone. The aroma is roasted with coffee, a hint of smoke and some liquorice. The taste is a fine mix of sweetness and a good bitter finish. The coffee is evident also in the flavours, along with raisins and alcohol. Medium body, smooth and creamy texture, soft to medium carbonation. Once again a very nice and good balanced beer from Nøgne Ø, but as is the case with all NØ beers Ive rated so far, everything is done by the book and there are no surprises.
 [50 cl bottle from Vinmonopolet, Grønland, Oslo]

Re-rating, 2011-07-16, 7-4-8-5-15=3.9
The aroma is actually quite hoppy, with a very nice touch of grapefruit. Also dark roasted coffee and chocolate. I dont get any smoke this time. Extremely smooth palate! Soft carbonation. Taste up from 7 to 8, Overall from 14 to 15. 
[50 cl bottle, batch 603, courtesy of my Dad]

500ml bottle from IPB. Batch 502. Consumed about 3 months after receiving. 
Appearance : Black with medium brown creamy head. Some lacing. Green hops. 

Aroma : Roasted malt with piny hops. Light chocolate. Dried fruits.

Taste : Soft carbonation. Roasted malt with some coffee. Piny hops. Borderline watery. Light bitterness on finish. Nice coffee and chocolate. Rather dry.

Overall : Very drinkable but a bit simple. Interesting coffee and chocolate on the finish. Enjoyable hops. A bit too faint on the nose and a bit too watery on taste. Not bad at all but a bit weak.

On tap at Sail and Anchor. Pours black with some heavy brown tinges coming through. Big tan head produced. Dark fruits and spices with some wood and chocolate on the nose. Taste brings out a smooth coffee and some citrus hops which are overshadowed by roasted malts. Pretty good

(Today, for my one year anniversary on RB, a 500 ml Nogne O Porter from batch 502. Rating # 548)
Almost black in color with a large solid head and some lacing.  Nose is dark, nice chocolate and good coffee, small pieces of dates and caramel malts.  Taste is on the spot, mainly sweet with a black malt character, molasses, coffee beans and some fantomatic fruitiness.  Mouthfeel is medium to full body with decent carbonation and a smooth texture.  Nice sweet finish with a bitter roasty side.  Delicious.

Tap @ Cask Pub and Kitchen in London. Pours an almost pitch black color with a frothy tan head. Aroma of dark chocolate, roasted malts, coffee and a burnt note. The flavor is rather mild compared to the aroma with dark chocolate, burnt notes, roasted malts, and some faint coffee notes. The body is medium with a nice creamy mouthfeel. Overall a pretty good Porter.

Pours a deep heavy black with a dense,  light brown head.  Incredible aroma.  Im getting dark chocolate, coffee, raisins, and some caramel cream.  Flavor isnt very far from the mark.  Delicious roasted dark chocolate malts, caramel, sweet dark fruits, and some ground coffee.  Deep roastiness without being smoky.  Great full bodied mouthfeel, with sweet dark chocolate bringing back childhood munchies.  Awesome beer.  One of the best porters ever.

Bottle 50 cl from www.erzbierschof.ch. Black as a moonless night, small beige foam. Aroma closed of roasted, wet wood and coffee. Under a supple and a bit floury texture, the taste is roasted malt, a bit earthy, chocolate and molasses. Quite gently with bitterness of roasted, grilled almonds, espresso, rather light despite of the 7% ABV. Nice Porter with the chocolate which asserts over the sips.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ black with a tan head.Aroma of coffee, chocolate, roasted and toasted malts.Flavor is swwet and roasted with lots of toasted and chocolate notes.Medium body, average carbonation.Classic Porter.

Bottle from South Bay Drugs: Created a thick patching of foamed head as if it were the glue used to plug a hole in a car tire while the liquid was a dense and dark brown. Aroma is tame and only holds a faint and distant background of gently roasted malts with a chance of coffee or an unknown form of chocolate. The flavor is subtle and has good qualities for a porter because of the bitter chocolate like sweetness and the sudden richness in the aftertaste as if I just took a sip of coffee.

very dark ruby, can only see through the edges, clear with steady bubbles and a thin frothy tan head
nose is quite simple. soft dark chocolate and maybe some dried wheat/cereals
medium body and slightly fizzy (i was expecting more carbonation based on the bubbles)
Taste is rather mild as well. dark chocolate and burnt toast. there may be some soft nutty hints and some warm rasberries as well. this is a decent porter. not amazing but a great example of how a porter should taste.

Pours an opaque dark brown to black with head that dissipates quickly, the nose is strong with roasted flavors and slight sourness. First sip is coffee, toasted and rosted malt flaors, not over powering. I was expecting alittle more from this beer. The finish was clear with slight bitterness mostly from coffee flavor not hops.

Bottle 500ml, batch 539 at home. Pours an almost opaque dark brown with small tan head. Aroma is sweet dry fruits, note of coffee, Taste is very light sweet, medium bitter, Medium body, thin to oilt, soft carbonation, abrupt finish for a porter.
Slightly sour roasted malt smell. Dark brown head. Taste is mostly coffee but the aftertaste is quite watery. Very limited palate.
This black as a tropical night brew is a very nice experience. Full oily body with a medium head. Good balanced coffee roasted cereals  Suprisingly fresh finish.
Very dark brown like pitch black in the glass. Head is ok. Smell is dark fruits, roasted malts and coffee. Coffee taste, light bitter sweet, darj fruits, light spiced a bit to watery.
It sure got the typical porter characteristics of soft coffee, chocolate and dried fruits but the mouthfeel is a bit thin and the taste is a bit watered out.
(Bottle 2/2-11) Batch #518. Looks great in the glass, so I expected a more full bodied porter. Its still a slightly better then average porter.

Good looking beer with a fine beautifull brown head. Very roasted aroma 
Light body and, little to alcoholic for my taste.
I miss more body.
I dont understand this beer is among the best here at ratebeer, however Nøgne Ø is a good and very interesting brewery.
Clear dark red brown with a light brown head. Aroma is roasted malt, chocolate and sweet. Flavor is very sweet and light bitter. Medium body. The finish is soft and smooth. 020211

Poors dark brown with a very nice dense offwhite top. Tastes of malt, coffee and some caramel Very creamy in the mouth with good taste and a nice hoppy finish. A very good Porter that i want to try to store for a year or two. Nice to have instead of dessert!

Svart som natten, men toppen legger seg litt raskt. Dufter mørkt og mystisk av mild kaffe og mørk sjokolade. Smaken fyldig, men samtidig frisk. Ettersmaken er lang etterlater dilemmaet om en skal fortsette å nyte den eller ta seg en munnfull til.

Pours a very dark brown, with just a hint of red around the edges when held up to a light, and some light brown foam, very fine and dense. Strong aroma of vanilla, chocolate, and roasted malts. Taste is dark chocolate and roasted malt, a bit of coffee too. Wonderful stuff.

1 pint .9 fl oz bottle. With the pour, a nice creamy light cream colored head, brown cola colored, and a medium bodied appearance with some particulate. Not a whole lot on the aroma. Fairly fruity for a porter, theres some notes of peaches and berries, along with roasted malts, mild cocoa, light coffee, and earth. Body is creamy, though slightly hot and mildly carbonated. Flavor notes of roasted malts, similar fruits to the aroma with light berry and other mild fruits, caramel cookie, toast, earth, light resiny grass, and mild citrus. Overall, things just didnt come together as well as I was maybe expecting. Some good things going on, though not quite up to snuff.

A nice, off white head, on top of a black beer.
Aroma; This is really coffee mocca, with alot of chocolaty coffee on the nose. Also getting some yeast notes, maybe some spice and pineneedle aswell. Tobacco after some time in the glass
Flavour; Pineneedle, some coffeebeans, really getting a earthy note here aswell. there is a good carbonation, good lenght, and finishes solid and dry.
Summary; It does not blow me away, but its a really solid porter!!

Pours black.  Nose is dark fruits chocolate cake, coffee, and breads.  no hop aroma.  Taste is chocolate, coffee, and some malts.  Starts sweet then finishes dry but not too bitter.  Thin but smooth mouthfeel.  good beer but I expected more complexity and fullness.

Bottle 500ml @ home
Pours black/dark ruby with a tan head. 
Aroma has notes of coffee, chocolate and licorice. Taste is medium sweet, lightly bitter, full body, soft carbonation.

UPDATED: OCT 16, 2015 Bottle, 9%. Black with small light brown head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, caramel, hop, bread and a little lqiuroice. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, little over carbonated, bread, medium sweet, liquorice and a little bitter.
Nice porter but nothing compared to its big brother. Nice taste of sweet chocolate, coffee and roasted malt
Nose is roasted coffee, weak malt, creamy notes, feel is mediumweak, carb is mediumlow, taste is rotten fruit, some wood/port, rye
Bottle. Pours black with tan head. Nose and taste of roasted chocolate malts, coffee, cocoa powder and light caramel.

500mL bottle, pours black with a beige head. Nose of roasted malt, light espresso and maybe a touch of cacao. Flavour of rich roasted malt, a smoky quality, dark chocolate and espresso. A little thin on the palate, but this is a great porter.

UPDATED: NOV 23, 2010 Bottle 0.5L, batch 377, from Allen thanks very much. A dark beer with huge brownish head and good lacing. Smell is on toasted malt and chocolate. Woww a terrible beer, very creamy, nice dark chocolate notes and very smooth, no acidity not acrid. The malty side is well combined with a dry fruit and specially a dried prune dominant, the chocolate complexity is intense compare to the relatively low bitterness. Lovely porter a bit syrupy, the best I had, perfect brew for this alcohol level.

Note: I accidentally rated this on Haandbryggeriet Porter, but now I move the rating to the correct beer! 

Bottle, batch 261. Pours with a gigantic, brown, bubbly/rocky head! Very very dark, with a hint of nutty brown. The head is very firm, can grow well above the glass without spoiling out onto the table, and yields to nothing. E.g. tilting the glass has practically no impact on the head.
Great aroma, lots of chocolate/smoke/toast, reminds me of NØ Imperial Brown Ale, but slightly more bitter and more roasted. Very well balanced, with what I consider an appropriate amount of bitterness. Theres a hint of fruit, citrus and herbs on the edges, but the dark malts dominate. A dry, lingering aftertaste as the description says, with a nutty roundness. Gotta love that fruity, nutty, chocolaty malt aroma!
Full-bodied, somewhat slick, yet drinkable and well-balanced. Lively carbonation, very much to my liking. Not too much, not too little. I wish I had some parmesan cheese and/or smoked meat, which would probably be great with this porter!

Served on tap in a standard pint glass at TJs. This beer poured a very dark brown/black with a mocha head which dissaptes completely. Lacing is ample and lasting. Nose is chocolate, caramel, malts, and dark fruits. Taste is sweeter with dark chocolate, roasted coffee, licorace and some dark fruits. Hops add some citrus and a welcome bitterness. Mouthfeel is medium with decent carbonation. FInish is a little sticky but not unpleasantly so. All-in-all, this was a nice offering I would try again for sure

Pours a black color with a caramel colored head.  Has an aroma of roast and chocolate with hints of caramel and dark fruit.  Has a roasty molasses sweet start with perhaps some coffee spice and a nice velvety chocolate finish.  Medium mouthfeel.  Tasty porter.
Pours black with tan head.  Aroma of mostly cocoa and some coffee.  Well-balanced taste between hops and malts.  Higher alcohol content, but disguises it well.

Bomber served in an English Pint.  Pour is a deep, flat black with 3 fingers of tan foamy head.  Nose is salt, dark chocolate, raisins, dates, caramel, toffee, English yeast, and a light hint of sardines.  Taste is roasted malts, caramel, dark fruits, and dark chocolate.  The body is very similar to English Brown Ale, in texture and yeast taste.  The finish is somewhat odd as the salt, along with caramel and dates/raisins, makes its presence known.  This one is a very strange take on a porter.  It is quite good, but oddly, I dont think I could drink a lot of it.  Im left with desire by the end of many of the delicious bombers Ive sampled, but I am satisfied at this end of this one.
Draught. Black with a large beige head. Salty licorice, strong coffee, some spices, and fruits, hints of acidity. I like this one.

(500 ml bottle, batch #406 & brygget 210109 @ Olutravintola Pannuhuone. Rated @ 4.12.2009.)
Pours a pitch black colour with light brown head. The aroma is roasted malts, dark chocolate and hops. A bit sweet taste with a bitter finish includes also coffee, syrup and chocolate. Medium body and oily texture. No carbonation. Nøgne Ø quality.
UPDATED: FEB 20, 2011 0.5l bottle. Great taste of chocolate, and fruit. Nice color and top. If you like a good porter buy this!

Eit levande Øl! Myk og fyldig øl med kompleksitet. Lukter spanande som seg hør og bør! Forventningane er der, eg har trua! Dette var ein mildare guiness, dog betre. Skal ikkje sjå bort i frå att eg kjem til å drikka mei av dette ølet.

pours a jet black with a large light brown head that lasts, and great lacing.

smell is of cocoa, malt, a little fruit, some coffee, and some spice.

taste is of malt, cocoa, a little fresh roasted coffee, some fruit in the back, and a touch of caramel, ends on the dry side.

UPDATED: JUN 3, 2014 Pours black with a tiny head. The dominants in the aroma is dark fruits, roasted malts, liquorice and chocolate - textbook porter all the way. Taste of chocolate, dark dried fruits, english liquorice, coffee, chocolate, roasted malts followed by a dry end.

Bottle.

Of course very black, with a thick and good looking tan head. 

Nice aroma of coffee, roasted malt, a slight tone of smoke and chocolate.  A pleasant taste, yes indeed. Coffee, nice roasted flavors, chocolate. Also some coconut? Imagination perhaps? Carbonation was medium and the finish bitter. Not a heavy taste but enjoyable.
