Definitely get the coffee, not as much the dried fruits.  More of a nuttiness, really.  Damn tasty, but the palette seems just a bit thin to me for a porter.

Roasted malts and coffee aroma wasps over a deep black pour with a little beige head.  Very creamy and effervescent.  Lots of deep malts mingle with the tanginess of centennial hops, tastes like a scoop of vanilla ice cream was dumped in this.  Some roasted peanut flavor.  This is very nice.
Poured a dark brown with okay tan head.  Aroma was a ton of coffee mmmm.  Flavor was nutty and coffee some chocolate late as it warmed.  Mouthfeel was a little carbonated. Good beer.

This beer is the ideal Porter style.  Look "porter" up in the beer dictionary and this is what you see (and taste).  Dark, smooth, thick, chocolate, hints of sweet fruit and nuts.  Not the most complex beer, but whos asking for complex when you have such a high quality and consistent porter.  Wow.
bottel from Kingdom Liquors, Brandon - black quickly disappating head, roasted coffee, chocolate, dry slightly bitter finish - delicious!

beautiful black body with a bubbly dark brown head that leaves nice webbing on the glass as it sits.excellent aroma of chocolate,powdered cocoa,coffee,dark fruit,and smoke.flavor is much of the same with a chocolate milk finish.smooth,complex,and well balanced.this nogne 0 crew sure knows how to make some brews.

Beautiful beer, very smooth, mild and slick body with chocolate, plum, coffee and nutty notes. Basically, all the good stuff youd expect from a porter, none of the bad stuff...although the body couldve been more robust. Clean, smoky, soft, very drinkable. Classic!

Pours black with a very light tan head.  Smells pretty roasty, with some pretty nice chocolate and dark mlats representing it.  Very dense bodied, big chocolate, some light coffee, very roasty, nutty taste.  Tastes bigger than 7%.  Not a whole lot of variation between this beer and the brown except this one is alot heavier in its mouthfeel and body.  Pretty smooth finish.  Good brew.  Impressed with this bewery.

Pours out a deep black color with a small tan head.  Aroma is very robust.  has nice hints of malt and roasted nuts.  flavor was a bit interesting.  tasted like your run of the mill porter with a nice fruit taste to it as the description says.  I liked this brew.

Poured deep brown-rubby-ish color with a decent tan head. Aroma was coffee. Flavor was coffee, nuts, light chocolate support, some licorice. Finishes with a touch of bitter roasted malts and light hops. Much more simple than I was expecting, yet very enjoyable. Mouthfeel was lightly carbonated, and very smooth.
Bottle.  A unique porter, with a fairly good nose and an interesting taste of dried fruit, fresh dark fruit, coffee and a smidgen of dirt.
Dark malty and not bad at all with a sweet finish.Bottle with a sweet chocolate taste and a little roasty.I like porters and this was a little sweeter then most.CHEERS!

Bottles from oh6gdx, Liquid Solutions.  Pours dark brown with a thin ring of bubbles.  Smells of caramel, fruit, some tea and pepper.  Tastes of sweet chocolate, caramel, some bitter chocolate and spices.  Palate is full and syruppy.  Finish is sweet and lasting.

Bottle. Rich brown beer with red tinges and a tan head. Big roasty aroma with coffee. Chocolate/roast flavor with no hrashness and backing hops. Lingering sweet chocolate malt. Medium body. Like most of their beers Ive tried, its well balanced.

Bottle from LS tasted on St Pattys at Toms house. This, like the nogne impy, was a little bit different, bit a very refreshing change. roasted malts, chocolate,  and generic fruits highlight the flavore with smooth bready notes and very mild hop flavor in the finish.

oily looking dark brown. Thin tan head.
Tons of roasted malts hint at black coffee in the aroma.
Lots of coffee stuff but without a good chocolate taste. 
very light on the tongue.

Pitch black color with a very thin and quickly collapsing head.  Strong aroma of coffee, roasted malt, leather and oak.  The taste is incredible... its like a perfect mix of nuts, chocolate, coffee, dark bread and earthy hops.  This is an incredibly strong and excellent porter; it could totally pass as an imperial stout.

Bottle. Dark dark brown, with a shade of red. Nice beige head. Aroma contains fruit and coffee. Could have been more aroma, though. Strong taste of coffe and chocolate. Hints of fruits and alcohol. Aftertaste is bitter with coffee. (14.03.07)

bottle- pours black with a wondrful tan head, leaving behind really thick lacing definately worth noting. smells coffee, some smoked wood, brown sugar, a hint of alcohol and maybe some fruit. it is extremely smooth without being to watery. subtle carbonation. very fruity im thinking berries or sour grapes almost like a white wine sour flavor, chocolate,  nice smokey finish. very, very good.

Pours a dark smokey looking black, with a very nice brown/tan head that sticks around for awhile.  Nice smokey chocolate, coffee, and a carmelized fruit sweetness.  Nice medium carbonation with a hint of floral hops on the finish.  The flavor is not as full as the color and nose would suggest, but the finish is amazing.  Nice light choclate wafer sweetness with hints of coffee and dried fruits.  A very nice porter.
user_location: Farewell Minny; Hello Puyallup, Washington, USA

text: Bottle sampled at the Carolina tasting courtesy of Sam.  Thanks!  Pours out a black color with a big thick tan head on it.  Smell is sweet, full of coffee, chocolate, and some fruity notes. It was served at almost perfect temperature.  Taste was sweet and rich, with a heavy flavor of chocolate and coffee, yet very smooth.  Not flawed in many ways, a very drinkable, very good example of the style.  Thanks for this bottle Sam.

UPDATED: JUL 28, 2012 In short: A roasted chocolaty porter.  By the book, well done
How: Tap at Henrik Øl, Bergen Norway
The look: Black body topped by a long-lasting small tan head leaving lots of lacings on the glass
In long: Nose is medium roasty and slightly chocolaty.  Black chocolaty cookies, dates and some black liquorice are the main flavours.  Far from an intense beer it is overall rather smooth.  The body is full and the mouthfeel is somewhat creamy and the finish is pretty dry because of the roast.  Gentle medium carbonation.  Nice by-the-number porter that only stands out because of a dryer than average mouthfeel.  Very little hops presence.  The only thing that may leave a bitter after-taste here is paying the high price-tag
Bottle pours an opaque brown with a big light tan head.  Little lacing.  Basic roasted malt aroma.  Not very sweet, very dry, roast character lingers.  Good, not great.  Smooth medium body.

Thick and black, billowy tan head.  Aromas of sharp cinnamon and cabernet, charcoal and coffee.  Many layers of complexity.  Tastes of mayan chocolate and roasted malt.  Bright, defined fruit flavors open up with warmth, revealing raspberry and red currant.  Smooth palate, not overpowering with a touch of lactose sweetness.  Prime.

Bottle sampled on 8/16/06: Pours a transparent dark mahogany with a thin coating of tan head.  Sweet roasty dark caramel malty aroma has some bready yeasty notes.  Body starts semi-full sweet and smooth with a touch of milk chocolate and good bittering hoppy balance.  Very drinkable and enjoyable porter.
Bottle. Bark brown and opaque, medium beige head. Roasted malt and coffee in the aroma, with piney hops. Full bodied and smooth. Flavour is a litle too bitter for my taste.

This was very similar to Olfabrikken Porter just a little less intense.  I liked this beer more, but would much prefer something like Baltika Porter or Okocim Porter to this one.  Still a good beer though and one to try.

Bottle: Pours nice and dark with a small brown head. I smell a good deal of coffee in this one with some dark fruit notes in there as well. Taste is pretty smooth. I note a bit of roastiness and coffee. I also notice a pinch of vanilla flavor and that dark fruit mentioned already. The coffee really starts to come out after a few sips, as does the dark fruit flavor. This is a very nice beer indeed.

Strong coffee, roasted malts, vanilla and raisin aroma.  This is quite a delicious porter actually, with a good amount of bitterness to balance out the gentle lactose sweetness.   I can easily say that this is one of my favorite porters - robust, dry, bitter and otherwise just tasty.

Dark brown, nearly opaque, with a large, foamy tan head that shrinks to a small lace rather quickly - quite a bitter, dark roast coffee aroma, with notes of leather and tobacco, and background chocolate malt - creamy mouthfeel, with far less carbonation than the head suggests - leather and wood notes, dried cherries, quite an herbal hoppiness, and an undercurrent of sweet cream and espresso - some bright, berry-like fruitiness on the back end - a solid porter, but not one for the ages.

Shared by Rob on 3/15/2007...

Nøgne Ø Porter is a very, very dark brown beer that is extremely opaque.  The pour produces a compact, but dense tan head that seems to have a slight purple hue to it.  Coffee is prominate in the aroma with a hint of chocolate and ripened fruit.  The flavor is robust and quite complex as it shifts from coffee to bittersweet chocolate to dark, aged fruit.  A subtle anise flavor is also detectable after the temperature of the beer rises some.  The finish has a rich semi-sweet chocolate flavor with some roasted malt/coffee bitterness.  The body of this beer is full and the mouthfeel is creamy and smooth.  Nøgne Ø Porter is an very well made and well banaced beer that reminds me more of a stout than a porter...

25 oz bottle from Rivers Bend Wine and Spirits.  Specifics:  16.5 Plato, 30 IBU, 7% ABV.

Bottle.  Dark brown with a chocolaty brown head. Citrus sweet aroma with coffee like hints.  Flavor is roasted malt with milk chocolate flavors.  Sharp citrus accents.  Light palate with a slightly dry bitter finish.  Well balanced porter.

Dark Brown with Red Hue...Light Sandy Ring.  Dark Roasted Malt and Dry Hops on the Nose.  Mediume Mouthfeel...Comes Off as Solidy Simple Right Away.  Coffee Roasts...Sweet Malt...Balanciing Hop Ending. Bittersweet Aftertaste...Smooth and Dry.. A Great Example of a Porter

50 cl bottle from LS - Pours a dark brown color with a one and a half finger thick light tan head.  Light lacing.  Has a roasted malt aroma.  Flavor is also roasted malt with some coffee and chocolate to boot.  Has a slightly bitter aftertaste.  Full body.  Very nice beer.

Bottle... Pitch black ale with a small, creamy, light beige head. The aroma is of chocolate-covered cherries, toasted nuts, light smoke phenols and coffee. The flavor is slightly oxidized. Good balance. Subtle chocolate, light pungency and cardboard, light sweetness. Medium-bodied and chewy with lively carbonation. Chocolaty, charcoal-dry finish. Thanks to boboski for the bottle!

A Mes rate:
50cl bottle at Bier Circus. Wow. What a head. Sim and I have just sat here watching it settle. It came out so thick it looked like you could stand things on top of it. So solid and creamy. Very similar to the Imperial Stout, just a little mellower. Looks better due to the head and easily worth a 5. Slight honey in the nose. Lots of coffee and dark creamy malt. Very definite cocoa. Bitter and alcoholic finish, in fact the finish goes in distinct stages from strong rubbery notes, then bitter, then alcoholic.

thick creamy darkish tan head, foaming bubbles in the middle of the top.  color is blackish brown with chestnut edges.  aroma is roasted malt, a little nutty and some coffee too.  flavor is roasted malt and fairly dry with a bit of caramel/molasses in the middle.  hoppy/bitter/dry finish.

Bottle.  NIce dark tan creamy head (mostly lasting), into black opaque body.  Great lacing.  Aroma:  Strong of cocoa and some cofee.  Flavor of roated malts:  initially light sweetness...finish mid level bitterness.  Something different in this one....cant put my finger on it though (slightly chemilcally-not as off putting as it sounds).  Medium to think body.  Lively carbonation.  Slightly dry texture.  Long lasting finish.  Pretty damn good.  (Wait I think I almost have the different flavor...some of it is licorice....but still  more that is a bit chemically)

A nice roasty, chocolate, coffee, dark fruit, oak nose.  Pour is a very dark brown/black with a pretty good light tan head.  Flavors of coffee, roasted malt, and caramel.  Much roastier than the olfabrikken porter, but not as complex.

Alcohol apparent in the nose, a little too much. Roasty and woody aromas. Bitter chocolate and coffee in the flavors, nicely melded, a touch of maple. Body holds together well, even a little slick and oily.
user_location: Łódż, Warsaw, Poland; Michigan, Ohio, USA

text: Bottle sampled with Mad Indian and D.B. Pours black with a three finger thick tan head. Aroma of roast, nuts, molasses. and chocolate. The flavor is sweet, chocolate, molasses, roast. Good body, excellent brew.
UPDATED: MAR 20, 2007 Sampled with Stegosaurus and Dennis Bell at Monks Cafe. Black pour with 3 finger tan head. Roasted/nutty aroma with a very dry/ olive tasting finish. Well Done

Draught, at Ølbaren, Copenhagen, Denmark Strongggg, dam these danes (Ungstup & Sk8viking). Walked out of the place in a mess only to bup into Mabbsy and Calver in the lobby of the hotel on their way out to cause hell. I didnt make for a very pretty next morning in the office at 7am. Dooh.
(Bottle)  Pours a black body with a small tan head.  Aroma of chocolate, light roastiness, coffee, lactos, and caramel.  Flavor of chocolate and coffee with a bitter finish.

Bottle from Capones.  Deep black pour with 1-finger tan head.  Aroma of roasty malt, chocoff, molasses, and hops.  Tastes roasty malty, on the dry side, with a big chocoff element, plus hops.  Very complex palate that stays rather dry but gets fruitier, roastier, and more chocolatey as it warms.  Bottle conditioning helps this one.

Brown bottle, 0,5 l, batch 232, bottled on 100206, best before 100209, savoured on February 26 février 2007; eye: voluminous creamy coffee-color head that turns into a blanket covering the beer, black, opaque, some lacing; nose: nice roasted malt, high-cocoa content chocolate, vanilla; mouth: in that order, surpisingly smooth giving the impression that the beer will be thinner, but suddenly impressive arrival of the roasted malt, a little vanilla, dark chocolate, a bit of hops, finale all in roasted malt that becomes more and more acrid but in a pleasant way, lightly astringent, creamy texture, mildly bitter, lightly acrid, the alcohol is totally hidden, good carbonation, full body; overall: quite enjoyable

FRANÇAIS

Bouteille brune, 0,5 l, batch 232, embouteillé le 100206, meilleure avant 100209, acheté le 5 février 2007, savourée le 27 février 2007; oeil : mousse crémeuse abondante couleur café, noire, opaque, un peu de dentelle; nez : beau malt torréfié, chocolat à haute teneur en cacao, vanille; bouche : curieusement « smooth », donne même limpression quelle sera plus mince que prévu, puis tout à coup apparttion impressionnante du malt torréfié, petite touche de vanille, chocolat noir, un peu de houblon, finale toute en torréfaction qui devient de plus en plus amère, légère astringence agréable, texture crémeuse, moyennement amère, légèrement âcre, on ne perçoit aucunement lalcool, bonne carbonatation, corsée; en résumé : bien aimée

Bottle: Poured a pitch-black color porter with a big slightly off-white foamy head with good retention. Aroma of chocolate malt is quite interesting and well balance by some roastiness. Taste is a well balance mix between some chocolate malt with some roasted malt providing some bitterness. Texture is really creamy and this is appreciated considering the style.

Aroma:chocolate and light rosted malt...
Appearance:Dark,good brown head...
Flavor:chocolate,light rosted malt.......
rbesg06gt, bottled. jet black with a modest brown head. chocolate cake aroma, mellow texture, very chocolatey, would have liked a touch more bitterness but it was still very drinkable

Bottle. Poured a black body with decent size head. Aroma is of chocolate, roasted malt, and a small amount of hops. Flavor is smooth and creamy. Taste of sweet and bitter chocolate, malt, and a small amount of coffee. Gets better as it warms - first taste wasnt that impressive but found myself loving it halfway through.
Opaque brown with a large head. Aroma of rich chocolate and some coffee. Taste seems to favor coffee more, with some bitter hops. Sweet and bitter flavor. Slight chalky finish.

Bomber poured black with a thick and creamy tan head. Real good lacing. Aroma of coffee chocolate and roasted malts. The taste ahhhh, full mouth feel with real good roasted coffee and chocolate, toffee and cream.  An excellent porter.

Bottle via trade with pantanap - Thanks Kan! - Pours black with a nice creamy tan head that stays pretty well and laces some.  Aromas of coffee, slight chocolate, caramel, and a good amount of roast.  Flavor is roasty mostly with some good coffee and chocolate notes.  A good amount of caramel there too and a touch of liccorice.  Good smooth well carbonated creamy palate that I thought had a nice pleasant mouthfeel.  Pretty nice porter overall and I do believe this is also my first Norwegian brew..
Pitch black with a creamy offwhite head. Alot of coffee, malt, caramel, chocolate and liqurice. Intens and strong in caracter with a really complex taste and aroma!

Pours almost black in color with a one finger lasting head that leaves good lacing. Great aroma of roasted malt and coffee. Taste is of delicious coffee and bitter sweet chocolate. This beer could be substituted for your morning cup of Joe. The alcohol is very well hidden. This beer is dangerous.

1 pint .9 oz bottle acquired in trade (Mystery Swap v2) with Dickinsonbeer (thanks Paul!). Poured a dark, dark brown (almost black) color with a large sized tan head. Aromas of roast, chocolate, vanilla, wood, and coffee. Nice smelling Porter. Tastes of chocolate, roast, light caramel, and some coffee. Tastes a tad of a let down compared to the nice full aroma. Smooth body with the alcohol hidden. Lacing left on the glass.

Bottle.  Aroma of coffee and bitter chocolate.  Pours a light black.  Flavor  of coffee and anise, slight chocolate.  Palate is good bitter a tinge of alcohol also.  I liked and glad I have more.  A nice sunday sipper

(Bottle) Pours black with a light brown head. Roasted and lightly burned aroma with coffee, very dark chocolate and plums. Light sweet with a syrupy touch. Undertones of liquorice root and metal. Dark chocolate flavour with some light salty liquorice and raisins. Light bitter and sugary with hints of alcohol in the finish. Medium body.

UPDATED: FEB 4, 2008 I have felt that for a while this porter has been better in the first batches. But now it’s back in the original state. Good earthy-woody hoppy aroma from northern brewer. A very powerful porter, almost a stout, but with great many nuances.

500ml. bottle. Black with a small tan head. Aroma begins with light coffee notes, followed by dark roasted malts, dark chocolate and some perfumey hops. Flavor starts off bitter/sweet, with the roasted malts at the forefront. The coffee is not as strong as it was in the aroma. Dark chocolate and almonds also come through. Strange, astringent finish,  combined with the bitterness left my palate feeling beat up. The more I drank this beer the less I liked it.
UPDATED: DEC 16, 2007 Bottle. Black colour, dark red against a lamp. Aroma of tobacco and liquorice. Delicious flavour with tar and a salty finish.
Bottle at ØLbaren. Black - brown head. Aroma: Chokolate, cocoa,. Taste: Chokolate, roasted, cocoa, hoppy, very smooth. I Love This !!!
Pitch black with fine brown head. Aroma and taste are of roasted malts - caramel, chocolate & coffee. Hoppy punches. Filling body with a smooth mouthfeel. Lasting hoppy end! Good porter!

Nice pitch black with a huge head. The aroma has notes of bitter chocolate and coffee. The flavour has notes of malt, licorice, port wine, coffee and bitter chocolate. A truly nice and powerful porter!

0.5 l bottle. Black with tan head. Strong roasted aroma with coffee, bitter chocolade, charcoal and menthol. Strong dry, roasted and bitter flavor wit mentholy hop flavor. Soft and oily palate with nice light carbonation. Dry, bitter, roasted and hoppy finish with menthol and salty licorice. This is more like a good imperial stout.

Pour is black with light reddish highlights and a small thin tan head...smell is nicely strongly chocolate with nice roasty syrup notes too...sweet and chocolately flavor with some sweet coffee in the finish...seems a tad bit overly sweet, but delightful none the less...
Fresh malty aroma. Completely black with tiny lingering brown head. Strong malty taste, long finish.

22 oz bottle thanks to janka.  I didnt find much wrong with this porter.  Lots of creamy tan head on this dark dark pour.  Chocolate and coffee aromas.  Flavors were similar with some burnt malt flavor and a decent hoppy finish.  Very tasty.

Black colored, medium sized beige head. Aroma has sweetness, plums, chocolate and some roastiness, mild alcohol also there. Medium to full bodied. Flavor is richer than aroma: chocolate dominates, roastiness, coffee, sweetness and medium alcohol. Aftertaste dries to have bitter and alcoholic touch, hops there with slight chocolate. Good flavored, slightly too thin aromated porter.

(Bottle BB 03/07/10) Licorice, coffee and roasted malty aroma. Black colour (slightly reddish) and brownish, small, very slightly lasting head head with fair lacing. Sediment on the bottom. Roasted malty, coffee, licorice and slightly bitter flavour. Creamy, dry, softly carbonated and medium to full-bodied palate with a hint of alcohol. Very tasty porter! 29/10706

Bottle shared by sliffy at the PTFC. Dark brown pour with a tan head. Aroma of chovcolate, roasted malt and coffee. The flavor had some nice roastiness with both chocolate and coffe coming out. The body was smooth but a bit thin as well. Overall though it was a nice offering.
Bottle at RBESG 2006. Pretty solid, a little light, some orange in there I think. Let down by a crappy bitter finish.

Bottle from Papsoe: Black with a light tan head. Aroma coffee and chocolate. Flavor, chocolate with a very nice roasty bitterness, nice and smooth. With some coffee in the flavor as well. Might have been a bit on the thin side but was quite enjoyable.

UPDATED: OCT 29, 2006 Bottled. (Batch nr 245, BBE 030710). Pith black in colour. Minor brown head. pleasant coffee and chocolate tones in the aroma. The flavour is hoppy and coffee like. There is roasted malt as well. It has a sweet aftertaste.

DBF 2005, cask. Black, thin beige head and gentle fine condition. Pleasant sweet coffee and burnt roast barley aromas, full bodied in the mouth with a creamy sweetness and gentle bitter coffee notes, lingering chalky roasted finish with a little sweetness and a restrained bitterness.
Bottle. Good looking high and creamy brown head. Black body. Coffee aroma. Coffee hops flavor. Well rounded and pleasant without alcohol taste.
Dark with a slight acidity  on pouring. Well  rounded and dangerously understated for a 7 per center.Quite malty and some coffee preasence as well. Interesting label for an intersting beer.

LCRBM2. Very dark brown colour with thin beige head. Lovely dark malts on the aroma. In fact great aroma, beautiful. Coffee/choc flavours in mouth. Subtle, agile, never goes too over the top. Stunning and my beer of the Meeting I think.
Very dark brown, nearly black coloured. Rather small off-white head. Strong burned malty coffee aroma. Taste is also strong, coffee caramel roasted. Ending is dry roasted, little fruity, nice beer.
LCRBM2: Roast and blackcurrant in the flavor, blackcurrant aroma. Well balanced, pleasant but I want a bit more character.

[2nd Low Countries RateBeer meeting] Aroma of roasted coffee malts with some black currant fruitiness. Black coloured with a medium, brown head. Taste is quite smooth. Roasted coffee malt, some fruit and sweetness. Slightly dry. Well balanced taste. Very nice.
Bottled, LCRBM. Aroma of blackcurrant and coffee. Black color, light brown head, good lace. Nice sweet coffe flavor. Very drinkable.
[bottle in Hacket] Aroma of coffee and blackcurrant, some chocolate notes, dried fruit. full bodied, sweet, dry.

Bottle: Pours with a black body and a nice beige head. The flavour is with roasted malts, liquorice  and coffee. Finishes with a nice hoppy and balanced bitter palate. Full bodied. Good looking and enjoyable.
Roasted coffee, one dimentional in every way, i love this brewery but this is thier worst offering.

UPDATED: SEP 26, 2006 Bottle. Pours as black as it gets with a creamy light brown head lasting for a couple of minutes. Sweet roasted malt in the aroma. Also burnt coffee, licorice and even tar. Flavor is roasted malt and coffee as well, with hints of bitter chocolate. Long finish with a nice tip-of-the-tongue bitterness. Oily mouthfeel. A powerful Porter from the enthusiasts at Nøgne Ø. But if somebody insisted that this was a Stout, I probably would believe them.

(Bottled, Brewed July 3rd, 2006) Very dark reddish brown color with a medium, foamy, beige head. Strong, bittersweet, licorice-chocolatey aroma with some ashy and alcoholic notes. Dry and ashy, quite malty, coffeeish flavor with licorice hints. Long, bitter and dry-ashy aftertaste. Slicky-oily, slightly rough, medium to full-bodied palate with medium carbonation. A very nice, balanced and enjoyable porter. Quite close to the Koff Porter - yet easier to drink, since its not as dry and bitter.

Poured a clear dark ruby brown with a small beige head.  Roasted malt aroma .  Notes of coffee and big chocolate.  Hints of alcohol in the nose.  Chocolate and roasted malt flavor  Light carbonation and a light body.
Bottle. Black colour with light brown head. Roasted  Coffee and some fruitiness in the aroma.  Dry roasted coffee flavour .
UPDATED: SEP 23, 2006 bottle. pours pitch black. hoppy aroma. sort of buttery. chokolate and liqerice. very good beer.

50 cl bottle. Black colour with a nice head. Very little aroma of roastedness but in a smooth way. Also smooth flavour of roastedness and sweetness. Overall very smooth but with a very light bitter and watery finish.
Dark brown color, light brown head, brown sugar, cherries, cherry filled milk chocolate in the nose. Med body, milk chocolate, nutty, caramel mouth with a bitter finish. Yum.

(Bottle 50 cl) Pours pitch black with a weak, reddish tint and a handsome, creamy and cappuchinoish, beige head leaving laces. Soft aroma of hard roasted malts with a whiff of chocolate. Surprisingly light-bodied - almost a bit watery. Lots of roasted malt, lightly coffeeish and dry - very dry indeed. Lightbitter finish. Pleasant if not exactly a great Porter. 020606

Bottle. Pours black with a reddish tinge on the edge and a mocha head. Raisin chocolate aroma and its relatively fruity overall. Fluffy and light body with chocolate, oats, and bread flavour contributions. The finish is slightly metallic. Not bad. 

Sampled at the Københavnske Øldage 2006 on May 20, 2006.
Dark brown, almost black. Tan smallish head. Light aroma, sweet, fruity alcoholic nose. Dark, roast front, medium sweet sugars. Flat and boring forgettable porter.

500 ml bottle, via Mr Walker and sk8viking.  Completely black pour with a small and creamy brown head.  Very good retention, moderate sediment in bottle.  Very chocolaty aroma, a little yeast, roast, and some coffee.  Flavor is similar to aroma, chocolate malt and a hoppy bitterness up front.  Finish is chalky with a drying yeast character and a little burnt toast.  Mouthfeel is full bodied and slightly oily in texture with soft carbonation.  Very nice overall, full of flavor with a pleasant mouthfeel.

Courtesy of MrWalker

Very nice roasted malt and chocolate aroma but has a bit of a nose tingling sharpness to the aroma that I cant pin down. Dark brown to black body with a slowly diminshing thumb thick mocha head. Fore is slightly smokey and segues into stale coffee and chocolate. Nice roasty bitterness in the middle and finish. Doesnt quite have enough freshness to the chocolate malt asspect to it, but still a pretty spot on Porter. Some mild nuttiness in the far aftertaste reminds me of a brown ale.

UPDATED: JUN 8, 2006 Dark brown body, light brown creamy head, no laces; quite big, deep and complex nose: loads of chocolate malt, cacao and some strange notes like a combination of hop and yeast; very full, bitter body, creamy/oily texture; long finish, first very warm. creamy and  little bitter: cacao, malt, bitter chocolate. Lacks a bit the balance between nose and body, body is almost to powerful at least in comparison with the nose. Good (not great) beer. - - - - - - - Tasted blind at Sk8vikings amazing Porter/Stout tasting (5-4-6-3-13) - Black body, creamy small head; Quite small closed, a little metallic nose. With some brown sugar and very little dry hop; Big bubbled little creamy body, watery textured; Into quite long but very discrete watery finish, not a lot of aroma, mostly dry hop (like I could imagine hop the).
Batch 135 bottled jan 2005.  Just lovely.  Very rich flavour; sweetish taste of milk and chocolate, developing into a nice roasted aftertaste of cofffe.  Nice bitter finish.  Lasting.  Nam!

Bottle. Pours a black colour with a big longlating tan head. Roasted malty aroma with a nice hoppiness. Roasted malty flavor with some chocolate and coffee hints. Long roasted malty finish with some bitterness.

UPDATED: OCT 14, 2011 A werry nice porter! 
Black body, Lots of casade and sweet dark chocolate.  full body, Long finsih.
I re rated this now, when I drink this Porter in Norway.I Thin the Flavor is more caracterritic, and more tasty then ever. A werry nice Porter!!




Nögne Ö Porter from 19.07.03:  Bottle: Black colour, with a alost flat head. Aroma is dominated of sweet caramell, dry fruits, and choclate and some coffe in the end, yeas og cource  fruity finsh. aflavor is almost the same here, milder than the the was new, but enyay a comlisity that is nice and refresh, in a old porter. My bee if the porter was a little bit stronger( a imp porter round 9-10%) it will be moore carakteristic, But it dosent  matter I Like it it has a nice round  tastu profile and a mediu  to long bitter finsh. Interesting and a nice  profile with aging!: 7/4/4-16- 3,8!!

Bottled.  Traded with Sigmund and kept nearly 11 monthe before opening.  Pours a very dark brown colour with a reasonable tan coloured head.  The aroma is roasty and smoky with a touch of fish oil and some rich berry fruits.  The taste is burnt malts and again a little fishy character.  These are all things I like in a porter but the one additional thing which is missing is chocolate flavours to smooth it all out.  To that end I found this a little harsh, but nonetheless it was very pleasant.
Dark brown colored with a nice medium light brown head. NIce light sour and chocolate nose. Hazelnuts and Chocolate with a burnt malt finish.
Toasted malt nose, dark brown color, sticky tan head. Chocolate tastes, smokey at times, woody in the middle. Charcoal end. Medium body. Rustic, but quite enjoyable.

500ml bottle, batch No. 60 from Feb.04 (bb.22.02.2007). Ruby black coloured. Brownish head mostly diminishing but leaving nice filigranes on the glass. Appealing roasted malty aroma. Well rounded flavour with a solid taste of dark burnt chocolate. Nice bittersweet aftertaste. Very good after more than a year in the cellar.
Bottle. Regular porter aroma of roast malt. Color is dark brown to pitch black. Tan head with good duration. Taste is roast malt, coffee, chocolate and lots of licorice in the end.

UPDATED: JUN 6, 2009 First ratingBottle from Swedish "Systembolaget".Pitch black color with a nice brown head. Burnt sort of smokey scent. Extremely burnt taste, but not so much after taste.7/4/7/4/15=3.7RerateBottle at 3 Små Rum, Göteborg, om Jun 6, 2009Black color, brown head. Roasted scent, malty and roasted taste. Rather mellow, specially trying to compare it with last time I tried it. Smooth to medium mouthfeel, rather low bitterness.6/4/6//13=3.3
Black colour, rich head. Roasty aroma with notes of smoked ham.  Roasty flavour with long, bitter aftertaste.
Bottle. Yummy. Black and delish. Sweet, a bit of smoke and nice and roasty. Also a bit of chocolate.

Dark brown, almost black, with a big, tan head, leaving lacing alongside the glass. Citrus (grapefruit) and floral aromas are the first to meet the nose, underneath there are roasted espresso-like aromas as well. Espresso roastiness, some sweet fruit, good bitterness, some grapefruit. Dry finish. Medium carbonation, rather soft. The best beer from the excellent Nøgne Ø brewery?
Black.Off-white head. Lots of hops. Also much coffee and chocolate. Smooth mouthful. Bitter in the end.

Ashy charcoal, bittersweet chocolate, a berry-like fruitiness and salt in the nose.  Opaque, dark brown body with a low, off white head that recedes to ring with some lacing.  Charred roastiness interplays nicely with bittersweet chocolate and fruity characteristics.  Medium body is very dry with moderate carbonation.  Bottle (GBBF, Aug-05) sampled with MartinT, Rastacouere and Siroy.

The cascade hops orama is to heavy, taste of roasted coffee but to sweet.
I like it more sour

UPDATED: JUL 16, 2008 Bottle. Batch 147. Dark red/black. Light brown head lasting a couple of minutes. Roasted aroma dominated by coffee and fruit. Medium bitterness. Not so full bodied as you expect a porter. Dry, fruity aftertaste - leaving a taste of chocolate and coffee. KI=6

Irregular light brown head covers the not so opaque dark brown body. Strongly fruity nose, bursting with grapes and currants, complex and juicy. Additional suggestions of minerals, floral hops, leather would add more deepnedd were they better integrated. Finishing with a watery tang, due to a particularly thin body with very mellow carbonation. Competent alcohol dissimulation. Dryish ashey-dark chocolate malts and floral hops complete the otherwise sweet portrait. Some good individual flavors, but quite small in size and not as cohesive as Id hoped.

Any first impressions?
-Barely a ring of head rests atop the opaque brownish-black.
-Dark cocoa proffers a clean perfume.
-Mouthfeel is powdery and thin-bubbled.
-Flavors are balanced, but not too expressive.

What if you dig deeper?
-Subtle vinosity flows under the chocolate.
-The meager malt roastiness is of a short length.
-Herbal hoppiness undermines the roasty malt.
-No alcohol apparency for this quiet, humble porter.

Bottle; batch 147, best before May 08.
Nice roast aroma, a very good porter if not a splendid one. I think they can improve this.

UPDATED: FEB 16, 2009 Bottled. Dark brown, almost black, with a medium sized tan head. Roasted aroma with coffee, chokolate and a littled fruitiness. Roasted coffee flavor with some chocolate. Quite dry, roasted finish, yet with some fruityness. Definately not to be rated at fridge-temperature. Rating: 7-4-7-4-14-3.6. (060103)Bottle. It pours a next to black body, quite clear, with a tan head of moderate size. Chocolate, coffee and roasted malts in the aroma. Coffee being the most evident. Theres some hoppy aromas in the far back, giving a slight touch of citrus-peel. Full-bodied, mellow and nicely carbonated. Dry on the palate, yet with a sweetish, chocolatey flavor. Coffee, heavily roasted malts, citrusy notes and some alcohol too. In the far back theres some licorice and dried fruits. The finish is shared masterly between hoppy bitterness and bitterness like that found in coffee. Medium duration, but the base flavor of the beer rests in the mouth for a long time. The alcohol is also blending in. Considering its 7% ABV, it slides down dangerously easy. Lovely with some chocolate. (090216)

UPDATED: JAN 8, 2009 Biggish brown head. Nearly opaque dark brown body. Roasty coffeeish aroma with hoppy oily rye notes. Dry-sweetish taste, with an acidic edge, of burnt sooty rye with vaguely citric hop notes. Very harmonic and balanced. Full-bodied. Soft mouthfeel. Dry delicate burnt aftertaste with grainy chocolatey notes. Burnt notes linger. Very, very good and highly drinkable. Grew on me as I drank. (0.5l bottle, Wine monopoly, Oslo.)

UPDATED: JUN 4, 2006 Pours black with a grey/brown head. Diminishing lacings. Medium sourness. Aromas of leather and roasted coffee. Nice CO2 level. A bit too light bodied. roasted coffee finish.                               

Re(blind)rated at sk8vikings 7-3-6-3-14
Dark brown, almost black porter. Not much aroma, mainly burnt notes. Not a very complex flavor. Dark and some chocolade.

Bottled.
Black, huge beige head.
Salty aroma from licorice and tar.
Soft, milky palate.
Salty and burnt flavour. Mmmmmmm!

Cask (gravity dispense), Chelmsford Beer Festival, July 2005. Oily, black appearance. An abundance of chocolate in the aroma. Smoky, rich malt flavour. Starts fairly sweet, but picks up bitterness towards the finish. The bitterness lingers in the dry aftertaste. Creamy mouthfeel. Rather different from British style porters, but very impressive.

Bottled. Black colour, brown mediumsized head. Strong aroma of roasted malt with chocolate. Also hints of coffee. Flavour is coffeeish and roasted malt along with dark chocolate and some caramellish hints. Strong dark chocolate and roasted coffee in aftertaste. Very pleasant.

Intense yet smooth roast flavour with some coffee, black colour. Some quality bittersweet dark chocolate. Also malt and licorice. Good porter, not complex yet satisfying pint, well carbonated, fresh from Norway thanks to trade with Madsberg.

(500ml bottle) Dark brown body with beige head.  Aroma is mild, chocolate, nutty, some metallic, light grapefruit.  Taste is medium sweet, chocolate, some nutty, grapefruit.  Soft medium body, low carbonation.
Bottle at RBESG Grand Tasting 05. Brown, small head. Strong Porter - very strong in fact. Smooth, with a crispy, fizzy finish. Some tonic water pleasantness. Excellent stuff.
Black redish colour, tan head. Dark chocolate, coffee nose. Malty chocolate flavour with some caramel notes. Slightly acidic finish. Really tasty.

UPDATED: OCT 31, 2006 Bottled @RBESG05 (bottled 02/2005)
Opaque black, small tanned head. Roasted coffee head. Coffee in the flavor. Bitterish aftertaste. Welldone brew! (8/5/7/4/16 4.0)
Pitch black, tan head. Toasted coffee beans and chocolate in the nose. Full-bodied, roasted malty with coffee and chocolate. Well-balanced and really tasty. (8/5/8/4/17 4.2)
Black with a nice steady brown head. Roasted aroma from tar, licorice and dark chocolate, salty and a bit smoky. Milky, creamy flavor with tar and licorice, salty and with a nice bitter finish.
Cask at Chelmsford Beer Festival. Dark full bodied sweet roast malt porter with some hops. Fairly dry finish. Would be better if fermented out more but still very good.

bottled; thanks to fiulijn - pitch-black and a fine creamy, brown-tainted head gives it a perfect appearance; it has a powerful nose where toasted coffee first comes to mind but it is in fact complexer than that as chocolatey and plumy notes are here also; a bit acidic, sweet and quite oily, fairly strong malt body supported by a rather high carbonation; the finish is dry and very roasted with more coffeish and cocolatey notes, the whole thing being quickly overtaken by a strong and warming alcohol kick

A really nice soft roasty porter. Smoky chocolate flavours also notice, touches of dark fruit.berries but the main thing is the roasty characters. Finish is quite dry and more-ish, i like this a lot.
Bottle. Tannic, chocolate cake, thin, caramel. Nothing mindblowing here.  Yup. Thanks to Kristian for the beer!

Red with orange hues at the dge, some ring of head.  Cool bottle color scheme.  The aroma is like drinking a cup of coffee in the marine house (penguin exhibit) at the zoo, such is the mix of aromas.  An average palate with moderate carbonation and low bitterness in the finish, with some roasted qualities but not to the exclusion of more diverse inspirations.

Cask Conditioned, 2005-05-21, 8-4-9-5-17=43Black color. Very nice aroma, hoppy and earthy. Lovely taste! Malty, hoppy, sweet, bitter, aromatic, with a touch of spices and liquorice; chocolate, roasted malt. Excellent! Fresh.Bottle, 2005-05-21, 7-5-8-4-15=39Dark color; thin creamy head. Complete different aroma from the Cask version, amlty and lightly roasty, with a touch of vanilla and paperboard. The flavor is more aggressive (carbonation) and straight-forward: roasted malt, malt, some liquorice.

deep garnet brown that is almost black. aroma is weak coffee pepper and wood. taste is caramel, fruity with a lingering bitter on the tongue. finish is grape like an interesting brew, thanks to my danish friends for supplying this one.
Cask at Ølbaren. A great porter. Coffee aroma, and taste. Finish is sweet and creamy. A great porter with great complexity.

Bottle: Black coffee, burnt caramel edges, moderate sand colored head, settles quickly, with very nice lacing.   Pale roasted malt aroma, even softer hop.   Milk sugar like sweetness, with a very soft porterish flavor profile.   Seems like a "Milk Porter".   Moderate body and mouthfeel.   Lactic like finish.   I thought it was a decent porter, but a bit light overall.

Cask at DBF2005. A tasty, nice roasted and surprisingly fresh porter. I have tried this from the bottle several times, but from cask this is much more fruity. Sweet malty aroma with a touch of coffee,  chocolate and some liquorice. One of my favourite porters.
Cask at DBF2005. Pours almost black with a   shortlived frothy tan head. Aroma is of dark roasted malts, bread, coffe and bitter chocolate. Taste is fullbodied, dark malts, cofee and chocolate.
Cask at DBF2005. Very nice nose, milk chocolate, some malt. Pitch black, bubbly tan head. Good roast, chocolate, ends rather dry. Very nice porter.

Thanks to Madsberg for this treat!
Dense dark color with a good tan head.
Roasted malt and caramel aromas easily rise to meet the nose from this one.
Well balanced flavor fades into a long roasty finish that lingers with the coating of flavors left on the tongue. Very enjoyable Porter!
Black beer. Aroma/taste of roasted malt + chocolate. Is very drinkable. The price is a bit too high... But I have no doubt that I will try it again.
Black color with a nice beige head. The taste is sweet with roasted malts as the body. Finishes with a nice hoppy but balanced bitter palate.
Dark brown / black body with large frothy beige head. Roasted malty aroma with some coffee and a slight sweetness. Flavor is burnt malts with a slight vanilla sweetness and hints of chocolate.

Bottle from Santa: Boy this poured like a stout, nearly opaque and a large frothy tan head that produced very good lacing. The aroma has notes of burnt and carmelized malting, light mocha and licorice, aromatic and floral hops, dusty yeast esters and a touch of coffee. The taste starts with a twangy dark fruit and smoky character before given way to chocolate and malty sweetness. The finish displays some dryness and very sublime bitters. The feel is quite lively and has a bit more heft that most porters. While this is not a baltic which I figured it would be a first, it is also not like most of the porters we get here in the states. I liked it for what it was.

Good dark-beige head, slightly irregular on nearly totally black beer. Creamy, chocolatey nose, dark & burnt malts. Burnt malts, and typical sourish taste, fortified by carbonations. Tad of bitter chocolate, grainy. Some acid/roast burn, well bodied, but thinned by the acids. Good, but nowhere exceptional porter.

50 cl bottle. Served in OHara´s stout glass. Black color. Moderate, brown head w/ good longevity and nice lacing. The aroma is roasted and coffeeish;  dark and powerful. The taste is big and full: roasted, bitter, and slightly, pleasantly sweet. The finish is especially well-balanced between bitterness, sweetness and roasted notes. A well-made, finely balanced porter.
(on bottle)This a porter; it has ROAST written all over. Coffee, burnt cane sugar, wood, smoke, english liquorice, Nordsøolie and malt; that´s it. Great brew; thx. Sigmund.
Copenhagen beer marathon 2004. Black color, roasted malt, coffee liquorice aroma and taste, medium body, light alcoholic finish.

Black. Tall (short) beige head. Good carbonation. Sourish fruity aroma. Licorice. Roasted malts. Rich flavour dominated by more licorice, coffee, chocolate. Roasted malts. Smoke. Dry finish. Good stout indeed.

Pitch black with a foamy brown head. Full aroma with plenty of coffee, bitter chocolate, roast and hops. Coffee in the flavor as well along with roasted malt, liquorice and some bitter hops. Foamy mouthfull. An excellent porter!
Black porter with a little, brown head. Malt and coffee aroma, but the flavour lacks a little bitterness and the beer was a little thin.

Dark beer with a low brown head.
Intensive aroma of malt and liquorice.
The taste is powerful but dominated by english liquorice.
A very good porter, especially on a cold day.
Bottle. Liquorice aroma. Black colour, small head. Cocoa-flavoured, roasted aftertaste.
Bottle. Black with nice head. Sweet, notes of coffee. Discrete! Soft and easy drinking porter.

A pitch black beer with a small chocolate brown disappearing head. The aroma is very sweet with notes of roasted bread and chocolate. The flavor is sweet with notes of roasted bread, alcohol, and chocolate, but the body is a little thin.

UPDATED: AUG 18, 2005 Bottle
Citric aromatic and roasted notes, some cherries.
Dark Red-brown, Brown foamy lacing head.
Coffee, chocolate,nuts, raisins, brown sugar and citrus - thats a lot of taste.
Brandy aftertaste
Good body, sparkly mouthfeel.
Good powerfull porter.

UPDATED: MAR 9, 2007 Thanks Per for an excellent beer.  Pours Dark brown with a large brown head.  Aroma of caramel chocolate and plums.  Sweet like brown sugar.  Flavor is sweet, slightly bitter.  Finish starts out sweet and end up slightly dry.
Dark brown colour.  Large chocolate aroma with light coffeeish accents.  Medium body.  Quite toasty, cocoa-ish.  Long and fairly dry.

Bottled. 
Brown. Rich aroma from grassy hops. Flavourful and smooth. Roasty, little tarry with notes of chocolate and some smokiness.

UPDATED: AUG 23, 2006 Bottled @ sk8vikings blind porter/stout tasting Beer no. 2. Dark brown coloured. Dense light brown head. Sweet and buttery aroma. Some light cocoa notes. Flavour is roasted, coffeeish and has cocoanotes. Seems a little unbalanced to me. Is medium bodied but with light watery accents. Is roasty and bitter in the end. Original rate: (8-4-8-4-16) Bottled: Dark brown coloured. Brownish medium sized head. Lasting. Chocolate, spices, malt, fruitnotes and coffee in the aroma. Flavour is smooth. Chocolate, light coffee and roast notes, hops, fruits and some spices. Is light bitter in the end. Well balanced porter

Nice chocolate coffee, oak and vanilla, creme brulée, milky. Smooth and creamy. Dark black-red with light foamy tan head. Medium-thick body with light carbonation. Starts with coffee chocolate malt, light acidic, smoky and silky. Finish is deep sweet bitter, a sour tang and light smoke. After is light tang, bitter, with chocolate. A very nice porter.

Very dark brown, almost black with a rich dense light brown head. Roasted coffee, dark chocolate, hops, smoke and dried plums in aroma. Flavour of coffee, minerals and smoke with small notes of tar, hops and salt. Powerfull finish of black coffee, smoke, dark plums and peppry alcohol.

Bottled. Black, rich head. Aroma of coffee and plums. Sweet, rich, salty and very burnt with notes of dates. Quite chocolatey. The mouthfeel is a bit less gentle than their Havre Stout, and it is cleaner and harder. Coffee and syrup in the finish.
UPDATED: JAN 10, 2005 Botttle @ Oliver Twist, StockholmNice chocolatey aroma, sweet, soft palate with some burned undertones. Quality chocolate taste and maybe a smoked touch.

UPDATED: APR 5, 2006 Rerate cask, courtesy of Cardinal, Stavanger. Same as the b.c. version, but with a minimal head, as no sparkler was used. Good beer! Original rating: (500 ml bottle). Bottle condtioned. Pours with an excellent thick & tan head. Pitch black, even when held to the light. In a blind test Id probably say this was a stout (not Guinness!), maybe even an imperial. Aroma of roasted malts, coffee, cigar box, English pipe tobacco and dark bitter chocolate. Flavour is again roasted malts, coffee and dark chocolate. Not too sweet, excellent bitterness where you can sense the hops as well as the roasted malts.
